Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, recommended”
Reviews.Author: BG007
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here recently while on a business trip. The booking was made by a colleague who has all the right cards and memberships, which probably accounts for two things. One, an upgrade to a one bedroom suite, which, to be honest, was more than I needed, and two, a never-seen-before $48 daily food credit to consume at the hotel restaurant or room service. My oversized room was a bit dated, but nice and comfy - what you would expect from a decent 4 star property. There were no wireless internet connection or in-room safe though. As I got to know the hotel's food related services (did I mention the daily $48 food credit?), I found that while both room service and the restaurant were equally pricy, food delivered by room service was somehow better, as if they were coming from two different kitchens. I would say the restaurant is not more than average, however breakfast was quite good. Front desk was friendly and efficient, and by the way, those who aren't too obsessed with getting the room serviced daily can get an additional $5 credit for… yes, the restaurant. Overall, a very good stay, and at a good rate a recommended choice if you don't mind checking out a couple of pounds heavier than you'd arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Argos Cheerleader Tryouts”
Reviews.Author: Bevans1342
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd year holding the tryout for the 2 days. The hotel staff were great from the frontdesk staff, the maintenance crew and the event staff. They always were there when you have an urgent requests at the snap of a finger. The Northern Lights Ballroom and the rooms where spacious and clean. Looking forward to more stays at the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and deal for March Break”
Reviews.Author: CANTRAVELS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for two nights during the March break. We got a great deal by calling and getting a CAA rate for $118.00 a night that included breakfast. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff who helped direct us to the self parking area ($20 per night with in and out preveledges) and got checked in without a problem. The room was quite spacious with a separate sitting area, desk, fridge and king size. Although the bathroom was a little dated, it was large and had plenty of hot water and water pressure. It was a great place for the price and location. The buffet breakfast was also very good and a good way to start our day. Our only problem or suggestion would be to ask for a room on the opposite side of the train tracks for those who are light sleepers because it can get quite noisy and busy in the morning. Also when we requested to use a microwave and were told that they would send one up, it took over an hour and three phone calls to make it happen. I would have preferred they told me no than have to wait that long. Otherwise it was a great place and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Great staff. Needs a renovation”
Reviews.Author: Erick967
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights during a conference in downtown Toronto. Staff was very nice and helpful. The bar looking over Rogers Field was nice. Room was just okay. Whole hotel definitely in need of a renovation. Dirty carpets, fading, chipped paint and fixtures. Noisy heating/aircon. Toilet plugged and wouldn't drain correctly even after 2 calls to maintenance. Restaurant staff not very good. Slow and not very helpful. Sometimes rude. Seemed like the staff not really interested in their jobs. Being part of the Rogers Center isn't enough to make up for deficiencies.

Reviews.Title: “Just average for us”
Reviews.Author: moe777
Reviews.Content: We have been to much nicer hotels for the same price. Room was just basic, had king size bed and little TV area that you got to by climbing three stairs. Really needs to be modernized. Staff were pleasant. There was a noise in our room when running our cool air which was really annoying. Had to call maintenance the next morning to have it fixed. Beds were kind of firm but okay. Parking was convenient. Hotel is situated in close proximity to restaurants, sights and lots of shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay at the Renaissance Toronto Downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Amy2232
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for a conference at the convention centre and this hotel was perfectly situated for me to take a 5 minute walk to my seminars. The room I stayed in was extremely clean, spacious, and had a great desk for me to do my work on in the evening. At any point when I came into contact with staff they were efficient and friendly. Although this trip was for business purposes I am already looking to take my family to this hotel this summer for a baseball game!

Reviews.Title: “Reflections of my stay at Rennaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kabahenda k
Reviews.Content: The staff are verr courteous! I arrived late but the staff was willing to accommodate my request for a drink. In the morning, I would not gstart the coffee machine and the staff was once again very understanding and ready to help. The quality of cleanliness is excellent. I will recommend the recommend the Rennaissance Hotel to all my friends. Very good job. Keep it up.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at the "Old Sykdome",”
Reviews.Author: moses k
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the evening but we were very well received by staff, and we were able to get good food, though kitchen staff was supposed to close by 10 pm. The room was amazing: large, comfortable, clean, well lighted, and peaceful; We slept soundly, and woke up to a nice and hot pot of coffee. Indeed, we had a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_1024
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with my boyfriend after going to the Auto Show at the Convention Centre. Typically the Auto Show is at the Rogers Centre and the Convention Centre but I guess last year they condenced it all into the Convention Centre. The Convention Centre is still very close only about a 3-5 minute walk from the hotel. This is a perfect hotel if you are going to the Rogers Centre, Convention Centre, Air Canada Centre, or the CN Tower, all within walking distance. The hotel over all is very nice and clean. It exceeded my expectations as other reviewers had said it was outdated. The ONLY part I felt was a little outdated was the hallways to the rooms although the hotel has done a nice job with paint and window coverings to help make it look modern. Our room was on the 11th floor and although it was not a sutie it was probebley the biggest hotel room I have been in. The bathrooms are also very laege as well. It was very spacious and if you had a young child that needed a crib or you were bringing a crib there is a lot of room for that. We did use the pool and hot tub and both were very nice. There are change rooms there and towels are provided at the pool. The elevators are at one end of the halls so if you have mobility issues then do request a room closer to them. Parking is $20.00 for self parking and $30.00 for Valet, typical for parking in Toronto and it IS onsite underground in the Rogers Centre which was nice. The ONLY negative thing of the entire stay was that the Train Station is just down the street so VIA Rail Trains and GO Trains go by about every 5-10 minutes as there are a number of tracks right in front of the hotel. This did not bother us much but we were on the 11th floor and had thought that it must be much louder on the lower floors. When the trains did go by the noise would only last about 5-10 seconds. The sound did not keep us up at all at night. Just more of an FYI. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone and we would stay here again. We got a good deal on Expedia so that might be a way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value and Price in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: sneaky291
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night with a good friend who I was showing around Toronto. The location is very good as I knew my friend would want to see the CN Tower, and Rogers Centre. My main reasons for choosing this hotel are: 1) I got a pretty good rate. $139 on the internet for 2 double beds. 2) The hotel and Rogers Centre are located just off the Gardiner Expressway, so driving in is easy. No stop and go in busy downtown Toronto traffic should we have arrived at a bad time. 3) Parking would be easy, it's a stadium... 4) It's close to, as I mentioned the CN Tower and Rogers Centre, but also close to the restaurants on Front St and Union Station. It's a great 'jumping off' point. We arrived early afternoon on a friday, our room was ready, and the valet took our car. The whole operation was seamless and we were in our room within 30 minutes. We also arrived about an hour before the 3pm check-in time. We were given a 10th floor room with a city view. Upon inspection of the room it was easily determined that the room was not finished being made up. The shower curtain wasn't hung up, the towels weren't in place, the mirror was very spotty (like someone hadn't wiped it after spraying it with something, I'm not a picky guy). Also there was a big hair under the comforter, that was a little tough to ignore. One quick call to Front Desk informing them of the situation in which I nicely and with some humour explained my misgivings and what it is I would like to see happen (a new room on the same floor, if it could be accommodated), and I was back in the lobby exchanging room keys for a new room a few doors down and receiving apologies. The initial room was substandard, however the staff corrected the shortcoming quickly and did their best to respect my requests. I didn't think of the first room for the rest of our stay. I must give a thumbs-up to the beds and bedding. I have two small children and I suffer the sleep deprivation that goes along with it. The bed and bedding was fantastic, and the combination of bed, bedding, and a few extra hours of childless sleep worked wonders for me. We ordered up 6 beers (Stella Artois), come to a little under $50. Most people would complain but I've never been to a hotel that didn't charge like this for room service, particularly alcohol. I'm not saying it's good, I'm not saying it's bad, I'm just saying... Check out was easy, there were no errors on our bill, and the valet had our car brought around in under 5 minutes. Good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Novelty Value”
Reviews.Author: beauxl2002
Reviews.Content: This place has got something big going for it. The view over the Skydome playing field is a great novelty, even if there isn`t a ballgame on. There is a bar perfectly place to just sit and enjoy with a cold bottle of Canadian. Everything else about the hotel is everything you would expect from a 4 star property in Toronto. Large rooms, comfy beds, polite staff and clean. It also is only a 10 minute walk from Union station as well as the many bars and eateries in that vicinity. I would imagine this would be a great place to stay for sports events to for obvious reasons. It is also 5 minutes stroll to the CN tower. One negative is the proximity of the rail lines, which can get a bit loud during the rush hours, but the solution to this is to either ask for a high room, or upgrade to the rooms which lookout over the ball park.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: bostona
Reviews.Content: It's the hotel connected to the Rogers Centre, so it's fantastic for a Blue Jays game. I was there in the offseason but it's stiil very centrally located and within a 10' walk of the Air Canada Center and all the major downtown attractions. Very friendly staff, nice rooms, definitely my choice were I to go back to Toronto anytime soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Convenient Location and a decent price”
Reviews.Author: travelbugNY_10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and received a very nice rate for our Feb. (President's Day weekend) trip to Toronto. At first I was certain I would find the hotel to be outdated (based on online eviews) and in a downtown location that was more business than leisure. I was pleasantly surprised on both fronts. It might have been a tab bit outdated, but overall the service was really good, rooms clean, and location turned out to be a very convenient one for our weekend plans. We were within short walking distance of The Second City, CN Tower and theater, all of which we availed ourselves of. There's a great breakfast place, Cora's, down the block from the hotel. A great grocery store right across the street for buying quick bites, water, etc.. It's is also within walking distance of the harborfront and even old city, where you'll the distillery district and St. Lawrence market. Even though it is not an ultra-hip, trendy hotel, I found our stay to be perfectly fine and enjoyable. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, comfortable beds, quiet rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: allcityd
Reviews.Content: After an AWFUL stay at the Holiday Inn Markham, we checked out early from there and via Hotwire, booked a "4 Star Stay" in the entertainment district. It was our first time booking via hotwire, and took a gamble on the room, but because we so urgently needed to get out of Markham, we took what we could get. We received the room rate at 90$ (hotwire price) but ended up going a day early. The hotel booking agent gave us the CAA auto club rate (118$) and offered us an upgrade for our room. Which really meant little to us, we just asked that we have a king sized bed. When we arrived the room wasn't ready (I arrived for check in at noon, and the room was to be ready for 1pm), so I waited patiently in the nice comfortable lobby. One of the desk staff came over to me, brought me a coffee and some fruit from the restaurant and offered me a paper. Within 15 mins of that, they came to let me know that the room was still not ready, but that they had put a rush on it (still 30 mins before I was supposed to have checked in). They were clearly making an effort for me to get into my room. When I arrived in my room, we had been upgraded to a king sized suite, and the room was very clean and nice. They had moved us to a "higher" floor (8th) and we had a city view. The room was brand new, the bed was full of pillows (8 in total) and had a down duvet. A few moments later the front end staff called up to my room to make sure that it suited our needs. It did. She then let me know that we had a 58$ credit for room service or for the restaurant to use at our discretion. The stay was good. We had a great sleep, even though our room was above some train tracks, the room was quiet. The staff were all very nice and accommodating. Cleaning services were fantastic, our room was always clean - and I mean CLEAN - there was no dust or bits of anything left on the floor or on the tv consoles. The pool was nice, gym was excellent and the hot tub was a treat. The location is a bit of a walk, but in good weather, you have only 5-10 mins to get to Queen St. East and plenty of restaurants. We used our voucher for the breakfast buffet, which was very good. (Bacon, eggs, sausage, waffles, pancakes, omlette station, tons of fresh fruit and baking, cereal, bagels, fresh coffee and juices) and left the remainder as a hefty tip for our waiter who was very nice. I really enjoyed this hotel. We had ZERO issues and I'm a picky traveller. For the price I paid (50$ less than the hell hole we stayed at at the Holiday Inn), we'd def. stay there again. We took the opportunity to check out the CN tower and in the summer, it would fun to be able to be so close to a Jay's game. All in all, we'd def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service eclipses a few glitches”
Reviews.Author: Ann R
Reviews.Content: As it was my first visit to Toronto, tagging along with my husband on weekend business and leaving the kids behind, I intended to cram a lot of sightseeing/relaxation into a short span of time. Mission accomplished with the help of fabulous staff at every turn. Literally, I did not find one person who did not stop what they were doing try and make my stay more pleasant (and Iâ€™m NOT a bikini model). I didn't choose this hotel. I probably would have overlooked it doing my own research, since I always opt to be right smack in the middle of a funky and walkable neighborhood and I favor either a really modern or really "authentic" feel, but I liked this place. And not because it â€˜s perfect. It isn't. Yes, the hallways are a bit odd and some rooms seemed quite far from the elevator at first. The heat did not work in the first room we were shown. It happens. But hereâ€™s what doesnâ€™t always happen: someone was at our room within 5 minutes investigating, and we were given a selection of rooms to choose from when the problem could not be immediately remedied. We ended up in room 403, a spacious bi-level room with a giant picture window. And when the Wi-Fi in the lounge was interrupted, someone was immediately on the phone with the engineer trying to get to the bottom of it. In the interim, I was directed to the Club Lounge and given another passcode. Itâ€™s also the first time I received a handwritten â€œthank youâ€� note for leaving a tip for housekeeping ($5). The Renaissance also turned out to be a nice walk (15-20 min.) from some amazing restaurants. Buca (Northern Italian) and Blowfish (PanAsian), both on King Street W. thoroughly pampered and delighted my taste buds. And R2 cafe on Queen Street W. is a great place to take a break from some fun shopping and enjoy a beautifully made cappuccino (they made perfect hearts out of steamed milk for Valentine's Day) and a pulled pork sandwich fit for a Foodie. The concierge also directed me to Kensington Market, which was a nice little bohemian oasis to visit for a couple of hours. The hotel is also right next to the CN Tower and attached to Rogers Stadium, which I imagine is quite fun during baseball season. A wall of windows in the restaurant/lounge look right into the stadium and there are about 70 rooms that offer similar views, allowing guests to watch games and events right from their rooms. However, if there are no events or events that don't permit viewing, make sure there are additional windows in those rooms before you stay in one. During my stay, part of the stadium was tarped off for a Harlem Globetrotter event, making the view from the lounge a bit dark. Didnâ€™t check out the pool or the gym, but the restaurantâ€™s buffet breakfast was pretty good (a little pricey) as was the poutine (French fries, gravy, cheese curds). Again, friendly, attentive service. I plan to come back, with the kids next time. Go Blue Jays!

Reviews.Title: “Overall and okay stay...but likely won't come again unless we may watch a game from our rooms”
Reviews.Author: PrincessPrima
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty outdated. For a 4 star hotel it really reminds me of a Howard Johnson, but a lot cleaner perhaps. We got the room through hotwire, which in our past experience when we picked a 4 star hotel, they land us a room at the Intercontinental. Instead this time, we got a room at the Renaissance that faces the stadium but there's no show going on. O well, tough luck, but still a pretty good buy perhaps. Throughout the afternoon and into the evening, you can hear noises going around in the stadium. The noise wasn't that bothersome - although you can hear it - and after leaving the hotel around 8:30 pm for dinner and coming back at 11 pm, the noise at the stadium is over. However, people walking around the hallways were horrendously insensitive to the guests who are resting! Every few hours we're awakened by groups talking in the hallway as they're walking towards their rooms, and then there's other guests opening their doors shouting and swearing at them to be quiet (I'd be irritated about the swearing if I have a child with me). There's a sign right at the elevator reminding people to be quiet but I guess not many people read that sign. The room is relatively spacious. There's a bathroom and bedroom section with it's own TV, and then you can go upstairs to the study/lounging section with another TV, which faces the stadium. It would be nice to have that room to watch a show/game. It's relatively clean, but you can see that it's dated as there's some wear and tear in the wallpaper, rusting around the mirror, as well as a tiny graffiti in the bathroom that the staff ignored. But for the price we paid for it, I guess I couldn't complain too much as we got it through hotwire so it's relatively inexpensive. They provide Aveda products as your shower products, so that was very very nice. There's also a Keurig at the "bar", which is kinda nice, but they gave you only 2 k cups....I've been in other hotels that provide you with a huge bunch of selection. It also would've been nice if they just gave us one small bottle of water that's complementary, which I think is pretty standard in other 4 star hotels, but no luck here. Overall an okay stay, but I won't really come again unless it's for an amazing price and there's no other $ comparable hotels available. I would probably consider it if there's an amazing game going on though. Overall,

Reviews.Title: “Booked as a gift!”
Reviews.Author: Glenda B
Reviews.Content: I have booked this hotel for 5 years in a row, for Monster Jam weekend. We gave this as a gift to our 2 young grandsons then they were 5 and 4, from different families and had tickets to see Monster Jam and we got them a cityview room each to go with it, so thier parents didn't have to drive them home late at night since they live 90 mins away. It went over so well parents and kids had so much fun that they asked again to go the next year, so we talked to the parents and gave them a stadium view room as a family gift, since one of the families had a new baby our 3rd grandson. The tradition continued we added the our son and his family, to our 2 daughters and thier families, so the total attending this year in 3 rooms (son and family, daughter and family, daughter and family) was 13. Six adults and 5 grandsons and 2 grandaughters. This is as good a review as you will ever get, it started a tradition because of good quality service, wonderful treatment by the staff, some of who remember them year to year its been going on so long, great amenities, wonderful pool, amazing rooms and beds, with attention to details when travelling with kids. This year the reviews from all were the best year ever, with upgrades in thier rooms and the friendly family feeling they left with. From the valet parking to the help from the conceirge, front desk, porters, the convenience of the wonderful restaraunt, everyone was wonderful, everything was great according to the kids as well as the adults, the request is in already for a return trip next year as thier gift from us for christmas this year. Makes shopping a little easier for this set of grandparents! Thier smiles and rave reviews make it worth it. Some year we will have to join them to see what all the fuss is about. A special thanks to Andrea Copeland, Director of Rooms who is wonderful if you need help booking multiple rooms with multiple needs for multiple families. They will be returning, with the help of Renaissance Toronto Downtown we have started and continued a Christmas Family Tradition, and you can't get better then that.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but dated”
Reviews.Author: dj_canada
Reviews.Content: Room was large but be sure to ask to be away from elevator as it is noisy. Bed comfortable but decor of room is boring. This hotel is functional but don't expect anything very upscale. Aveda products and Keurig machine in room nice touch. Weird layout around elevators. Four elevators but when you get off on floor, there is a wall between elevator 2 and 3 meaning you have to walk in two different directions to get to your room depending on which elevator you get on. Rather confusing until you figure it out. Food was excellent though. We had two days of meeting with catered food. Salads and entrees were all very tasty. Desserts rather ordinary though as meeting. Ate in restaurant and not only was main dishes good, so were the desserts. Our table had one of each! I would stay here again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy456
Reviews.Content: This is not a four-star hotel. Sorry. Hallways are dim, dark and concrete. ("Unique", I suppose is another way to describe them.) Lobby and check-in is very basic and standard. No assistance with luggage was offered. The elevators took forever, which didn't even make sense - there are not that many floors. Our room had some superficial upgrades - new carpet and bed for example - but infrastructure was average at best. The air circulation had a distinct and unusual odour, the bathroom sink had multiple cracks, there were gaps undereath and around the room door. Unfortunately we were there when a huge slo-pitch ball tournament was taking place and rather than putting "other" guests together, we were interspersed with the teams. There was loud partying in the hall late (2:00am) into the night and the hotel did nothing to stop it. If you are going to accept groups of this size, which I understand, you must pay for a a security guard or two to maintain the peace - so to speak. There were also dozens of cigarette butts in the stairway the next morning. The electronic check out on the television was very efficient and fast, which was great because we just wanted to get out of there. Wonderful location for a reasonably-priced three-star hotel with large rooms. If you want a four-star hotel, do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “VERY HAPPY!!”
Reviews.Author: Julie G
Reviews.Content: We had an amzing time staying here! The room was perfect! A great time had by all! We stayed 2 nights for an event and we couldnt have asked for a more amazing weekend!! Good things were just one after the other! We also took advantage of the wonderful pool and hot tub, what a great way to end an evening!! Thanks Renaissance Toronto Downtown Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “cool place”
Reviews.Author: lee p
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so unique. Spacious & clean room, pleasant staff. Parking is a bit complicated with longer walking to lobby. Enjoyed the views of the stadium from restaurant (not from my room unfortunately). Rate is quite high but the location is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Night away to the Rogers Centre”
Reviews.Author: Michelle T
Reviews.Content: I contacted the hotel two weeks prior to discuss our requirements and the room was set up perfectly with lots of spacious room to move for a family of 4. We requested a room with a fridge to store milk for the little one's which was accomodated. Lots of extra pillows and blankets. Hotel restaurant is very good but pricey for the meals. (ie hamburger and fries $17.00)

Reviews.Title: “Good value compared to other very expensive options.”
Reviews.Author: Panther67
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance Toronto for two nights. The location is very good to walk to the CN Tower, Air Canada Centre, Convention Centre, obviously the Skydome and many restaurants. My room was small(853) and did not face into the sports field but the bed was comfortable and everything was clean. I gave this hotel average because the fixtures in the bathroom and room decor was dated and a little tired. I would stay there again if I got the same reasonable rate compared to the more expensive options in the downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: JpNl2012
Reviews.Content: Bought this package through remarkable Toronto a touriste sight. Excellent price and got tickets to The Grace Kelly exhibit for a song. The hÃ´tel is very Nice clean large room and even a free Kurig coffee in the room. There just was no cream or sugar. The pool is nice but complicated to get to it. The parking is 20 $.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and location”
Reviews.Author: Banense
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in room 789 in December 2011 (a couple and a 5 year old child). I got the room as part of a special deal on Travelzoo for $99/night. I thought it would be perfect because it is adjacent to the Rogers Centre and we were in town to see the Disney on Ice show there. When I booked the room, the agent was very friendly but was only able to get me a King bed with a roll away cot for our child for an extra $20. When I got to the hotel, however, I asked if they had another room for the same price with two doubles and they were able to accommodate my request with no problems. I was glad they did not screw up on the bill and did not charge me the $20 for the cot which I no longer needed. Walking to that room was the longest walk I have ever taken from an elevator to a room ever. The room was wonderful, though. It was very spacious and the beds had tons of pillows. There was an LCD TV and a desk, as well as the usual night tables, dresser, and an extra comfy chair. What impressed me most, however, was the bathroom - among the nicest hotel bathrooms I've ever seen. It was huge and had both a separate shower stall and a bathtub, plus two sinks. Just amazing. The only downside was that the view from this room is horrible, it is just of a rooftop ledge and you can't see anything, except perhaps part of the base of the CN Tower. At least, however, there were no privacy concerns as nobody could see through our window. Even though the hotel is adjacent to the Rogers Centre, you still have to go outside to walk around it to the entrance gates. But it's still the closest hotel to the place in town. The self parking was an extra $20 which you pay at the exit. You park inside a designated area for hotel guests in an indoor parking garage which is attached to the hotel by an elevator. They give you instructions on how to get there when you check in. Like I said, you have to drive there but then once there you just go up the elevator which takes you right up to the lobby. Parking there is normally $25 so you save $5. They also have a valet parking option for $30. There is a Tim Hortons within a 10 minutes walk from the hotel and other restaurants everywhere as this is right in downtown Toronto. So you will not lack places to eat. We didn't go to the hotel restaurant as it was probably too expensive for our tastes. I found the service at the hotel friendly and professional, and was glad they got our bill exactly what I expected to pay for it despite the last minute change in rooms. For $99/night, it can't be beat. Even for a little more it is still a great location for visiting the Rogers Centre and CN Tower, and the room itself would have been quite perfect if it had a better view, but then again we weren't there for the view.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the downtown”
Reviews.Author: joshcna
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - very large rooms (you could fit 2/3 of our 2nd story in the bedroom alone) - and huge bathrooms. Lots of water pressure, and perfectly functional fixtures. The "City view" room overlooks train tracks, but you can barely hear the trains. (we were on the 5th floor) Excellent complimentary shoe shining service available (just have to call to ask for it). Pricey room service menu, but hey - room service normally isn't cheap. Good size LCD (LG brand) TV, and a Keurig coffee maker in a standard room. There's also a bottle of water with the coffee maker, but they want $6 for it. (go for a 5 minute walk to a drug store and buy a larger bottle for $1). All in all, great hotel, and I'd definately stay there gain

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: Sarahd73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. We stayed here when we attended a Leaf game and were able to walk to the ACC comfortably. They gave us a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite which was absolutely immaculate and well appointed with modern decor, a super comfortable bed, 2 tv's and a Keurig coffee maker. I would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Experience Ever!! Watched a Blue Jays game from the window!”
Reviews.Author: JZadow1
Reviews.Content: Myself, my cousin, and my 12 year old son, Brenden stayed here one night before my son and I flew back to Orlando, FL. We had spent 10 days in my hometown, Sudbury, and my cousin, Kevin, booked a room for our last night here as a surprise for my son to end his vacation (as we drove from Sudbury to TO). We didn't tell him (and he is a HUGE baseball fan)...so when we entered the room, he went screaming to the window, we got there just as the game started. It was perfect. We watched most of the game from the window and went down to the restaurant for some appetizers and sat at the window there. The Jays lost but it didn't take away from the experience. The room was gorgeous and clean and the view was amazing!! Perfect end to a summer trip :) The Tornonto brewed beers are so good, too...

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: Porchlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night away. Another wonderful deal through Travel Zoo. The room was originally booked as city view but were given venue view - which if there was an event would be an awesome room. We were switched to a city view - and the room is fantastic. Great view of the CN Tower. The room is 2 level, bathroom and sitting area in "foyer". Bed and tv/fridge on upper level. Ceiling high windows. Very quiet room, clean room. Only negative I would say it that it is a very very long walk to the elevator - was about a good 5 minute walk and when you're carrying luggage that's way too far to walk. We found other people on our floor who weren't as far as us, complaining that the elevator is too far. Elevator is situated in middle of hotel. Customer service was good as well. Ice machine was close to us and always stocked. We have already booked a room for June of next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Well located for restaurants, theatre and shopping”
Reviews.Author: crossingnorthamerica
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Dowtown Hotel is attached to the Skydome, home of the Toronto Blue Jays baseball team. However it is conveniently located for so many other Toronto attractions, hockey, theatre, restaurants, the CN tower, the lake and shopping. The bed was very comfy and the rooms are spacious and well-appointed. Parking, while hard to find - TIP - drive up to the front lobby and get directions from the Valet - is very reasonably priced for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: flyguy35
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. It was walking distance from the train station so getting there was fairly easy but a better sign at the corner of the convention centre would be a good addition. The room was modern and very clean. The room was smaller than other business hotels in the area. My conference started early and went late each day so I did not get a chance to explore the hotel. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, close to ACC”
Reviews.Author: 47Sandy
Reviews.Content: I went to Toronto for a hockey game, and stayed at this hotel. We had a great stay, the rooms are very spacious. The pool and fitness center were amazing. I didn't try the restaurant but we did go for a drink at the bar at night. It was only a short walk from the ACC. Overall one of the best hotels I've stayed at in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesonbeckwith
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before and it's always been a great experience. It's also really located at a central point to get around a lot of the downtown Toronto area. The room we had as huge, but in previous stays I've always been on the city view side. If there's not a sporting event going on, the rooms facing indoors don't offer much of a view. More importantly, with the roof closed, it was impossible to know what it was like outside and thinking it was still dark and sleeping in until 11am. Staff was excellent however. Valet parking was steep, but probably to be expected at most hotels in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmasri
Reviews.Content: On very short notice (three days to be exact) I needed a meeting space for a meeting and the Renaissance Hotel saved me when another venue cancelled last minute. The meeting space, food, and most importantly the service were all exceptional. The room was equipped with everything we needed and someone was there at all times to ensure that we were well taken care of. Thank you for your hospitality and friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Heather M
Reviews.Content: My husband whisked me away for a night away and took me to the Renaissance hotel, where we had a wonderful stay! The room we had was spectacular, and offered the best view of the city. The room was very clean and offered everything one could think of. The bathroom was out of this world. The staff were very friendly and professional and always went that extra mile to provide anything one might need. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will be back for another romantic get away soon.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and no in room wifi”
Reviews.Author: dyarger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty consistent with Marriott properties. I did not like the fact that they did not have in room wifi. Unless it is baseball season get a room with an outside view. Stayed here right before an NFL game and they told me they upgraded me to a room with a view into the skydome, well I had that view for about 20 mins before they rolled a huge banner over my window and so it was like staying in a cave without any outside light. Food choices are minimal and everyone was very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to downtown. Big rooms but very little furniture. Dated too.”
Reviews.Author: RandyMark
Reviews.Content: Came down for a conference. Close to the conference centre and a number of sites. Also a number of restaurants and close to many others if you know how to get around. The hotel looks the same as it did for the last number of years. My room was big and a little dated. Funny but there was very little furniture in my room. If you had more that 2 people visit, they would have to sit on the bed. But the bed was comfortable and overall the stay was good. A little pricey but not too sure how it compared to other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Kate T
Reviews.Content: We had a great trip to Toronto and had a wonderful stay at the Renaissance. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I left my ipod and all of our phone/electronics in the hotel room and didn't realize it until we were at our next destination and over an hour and a half away. I called the hotel thinking there was no way my stuff would be found, but I was wrong. The housekeeping staff turned in my lost items and Monika at the concierge ensured it was mailed to my next destination (even calling customs to ensure we didn't have an issue). Once she got it in the mail, she called me back with a tracking number and let me know the delivery time. I so appreciate the help! The room was also great - spacious with a pull out sleeper sofa for my daughter and a king size bed for my husband and me.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to get with the times.”
Reviews.Author: Rick N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for business or tourists. That being said, the hotel is lacking for business clients. There's no Wi-Fi in the rooms, so if you're like me and do all of your buiness on your iPad, you can't do any work from your room. The beds in the room have been upgraded and they're very comfortable so you can be ensured of a good nights sleep. I recommend you stay on the side of the hotel with the ball park as the city view side has the trains and they create a lot of noise throughout the night. The rooms furniture, carpet and decor is rather outdated and felt a little 80's inspired. Furniture especially seems old. There was no mini-bar, bottles of water or coffee in my room, so overall just an average hotel for service. I can't complain about the staff, but I can't rave about them either. They seem like they just to do the minimum required and they're not inspired to create a great experience for the guests, just the basics. Overall, an average hotel, with a great location. Good for families with basic needs, or a group of young guys in town for sporting events.

Reviews.Title: “great place.”
Reviews.Author: JC-Delage
Reviews.Content: Cannot get more central than this hotel. Home of the Blue jays baseball team. Very modern hotel, friendly staff. Well prepared and served breakfast. The rooms are comfortable, quiet, and very clean too.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 diamond property by any means”
Reviews.Author: Sandra G
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Toronto Downtown Hotel was a huge dissapointment. I have stayed at many 4 diamond properties and they were gorgeous, with impeccable service. This hotel should have their rating decreased. Unprofessional staff, rude valet, and accomodates well for the teenage demographic. Not a place to stay if you're 2 adults looking for a nice, relaxing getaway. This hotel needs a renovation, and a revamp in staff, to even qualify to being a 4 diamond. Perhaps they need to visit The Fairmont Royal York up the street to see what a 4 diamond hotel looks and feels like. Save your money, and stay at The Royal York, Sutton Hotel in Yorkville, or Four Seasons. I've even had a better stay at The Holiday Inn! There are some wonderful hotels in Toronto. This hotel is NOT one of them. Hope this helps you!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay for baseball fans”
Reviews.Author: FLXrayEng
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the week on business but wish I had more time. Right in the middle of downtown Toronto and close to everything, attractions, restaurants and shopping are all very close to this hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: quietreader
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for a couple of nights. Hotel is in a great location. Rooms are nice, spacious and clean. Find the staff very friendly and helpful, especially Jennifer at the Front Desk. The beds and pillows here are so comfortable...

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the adjoining rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Bluenoser80
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance Toronto for a work trip. This was the second time I stayed at this hotel in 2011. While my first stay met my expectations, this second stay left a lot to be desired. I was given an adjoining room, and without getting into the specifics, I was kept up for an hour in the middle of the night by the room next door. The noise-proofing between the rooms is terrible. It was almost as if the couple next door was in my room. I mean, when you can hear the details of a "transaction" you know the hotel needs to make some changes. I did call the hotel management after my stay to relay these concerns and they said that engineers were looking into potential solutions including reducing the spacing beneath the doors between the rooms. While it's good that they are trying to address it, it's not really going to help me out. In addition to this noise issue, there were a couple other things that got on my nerves such as being charged for a bottle of water that was never consumed (which required that I call the hotel twice and e-mail once to get reversed) and a lack of coffee whitener and sugar for my morning coffee (they have Keurig machines in the rooms). Overall the room was clean and large and the bed (despite being a Murphy bed - strange I know!) was comfortable. The bathroom requires upgrading as the bath appears to be the original from when the Rogers Centre was built and the lighting in there is terrible. All in all, the stay was not was I expect from the Marriott brand.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel but try to get a deal”
Reviews.Author: shazbot35
Reviews.Content: My first time at the Renaissance Toronto Downtown and I enjoyed it quite a bit for many reasons â€” the lovely, inviting lobby (there's even complimentary cider!); super helpful/friendly front desk staff; large, well-equipped workout room; double sinks in the bathroom stocked w/ mini Aveda products; in-room mini fridge; full-length mirror and small dresser in the roomy closet... But the best part might have been the hotel restaurant/bar, Arriba. Great view of Rogers field and a very tasty meal! Great location - near CN Tower, Metro Toronto Convention Centre, train station, etc. Keep in mind: Wi-fi is in the lobby only. Parking is an additional $20-$30/day. My only annoyances other than the wi-fi: found a long, wiry hair (definitely not mine) on the hand towel; the alarm clock was broken; and the comforter, though fluffy, seemed smaller than the king-sized bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Suite”
Reviews.Author: dnile
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Renaissance Toronto Downtown were absolutely brilliant ! When we arrived we had a couple of significant issues to sort out and the staff at the front desk were fantastic. Within minutes of arriving they had a taxi waiting to take me to Emergency and did a great job of helping my wife and daughter get settled. Well Done !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, still some issues”
Reviews.Author: Frankygoes
Reviews.Content: 3rd time at this hotel, same good service and some extra attention from even....the maid. Much appreciated! However, noise from the trains closeby is not very the best......and NO Wi-Fi !! that's very unusual....and not great.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, but no Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: Kims0304
Reviews.Content: The cool thing about the Renaissance is that it is actually located inside the Rogerâ€™s Centre. From the hotel bar and restaurant Arriba, you have a spectacular view on the stadium. I stayed here for business for 9 nights, during which we saw the Blue Jays play the NY Yankees and the LA Angels. They also have rooms that look out on the stadium, which is great for sports fans, but not if you like daylight. The room I had was on the Club level (6) and was huge. The bed was ridiculously large â€“ I used up maybe a fifth â€“ and very comfortable. The furniture was fine, nothing spectacular. The room was clean enough, as was the bathroom. Itâ€™s a shame that in a room that big, the closet was so close to the bed that you had to squeeze past it when the door was open. My biggest gripe about this hotel is that there was no Wi-Fi in the rooms. Big hotels still brag about having super fast wired internet. Who cares when there is no way to plug that into a Smartphone, tablet or Mac Air? If you wanted Wi-Fi, you had to sit in the lobby, and who wants to do email or Skype with family in the entrance hall? While the room was good, the restaurant served great food, and the staff was helpful and friendly, I am deducting a whole point for this antiquated practice. If small B&Bs can offer free Wi-Fi, so should the big players.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: Mav0627
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice but the common areas are getting a bit run down. Nice pool but hard to get to from the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend away with friends”
Reviews.Author: Wildinca
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel that is easy to find. Great location to access everything we wanted to do downtown. Not the newest hotel around but very clean and organized. It was a novelty to be able to look out from our rooms at the stadium. I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Brad H
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the hotel. The cost of our hotel included the most excellent breakfast (I'd recommend the fresh-made omelette). Perfect location for a Jays game or even a leafs game. Lot sof great restaurants near as well.

Reviews.Title: “Where to stay when location counts”
Reviews.Author: tippydepot
Reviews.Content: If you wanted to be in a sports skybox, this is the hotel for you. Part of there lobby is all glass that is part of the Blue Jays baseball, and their football teams skybox. You can have lunch and drinks while looking down on this beautiful field and never leave the comfort of your hotel. I was told you could also get a room to stay in, and they too are skybox rooms. Someone said you have to sign a wavior so when the games are on you have to be respectable in your room, or close the curtains! Great location to all the major sites, and Toronto is a really friendly city with new things to do and lots of things to see.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance? I think not.”
Reviews.Author: Alexjrosen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many, many Renaissance hotels as a platinum member of Marriott Rewards and this is one that fails to meet the standard of the brand. First and foremost, I was surprised at how dated the hotel was. The hotel was built in 1989, and while they claim to have performed a complete renovation in 2001, it is unapparent by the guest rooms. My room was on the ninth floor and had a decent view. The room was neither small nor large; what struck me, however, was how sparsely it was furnished and decorated. The walls were a bright yellowish color that, with the carpet, created a very "old lady" feel in the room. I mention this because one of the great things about Renaissance hotels is their contemporary, modern edge and this hotel was anything but. The rooms were drab and boring. The location was great, I suppose, if you are there for an event at the attached Rogers Centre Stadium. It is also a short distance from the CN Tower. I liked that there were convenience stores and restaurants all within walking distance. Unfortunately, the area in which the hotel is located lacks much character and shuts down at night, so if you want to go out drinking, etc., you will have to cab it to another part of town. My interaction with the staff was pretty minimal. The hotel does not offer turndown service (so I was surprised by the four-star rating so many websites have assigned this hotel). If you drive, plan to park valet, which is pricey but really your only option. Marriott needs to dramatically renovate this hotel or change its brand designation. And this is most definitely no four-star hotel - it is at best three-star, and possibly two and a half.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VanTheMan1313
Reviews.Content: Thought this would be a treat due to the description and the price, turned out to be a trick! Hotel looks nice from the outside and in the lobby but our room was not very clean and badly in need of a facelift. Staff were friendly and courteous but must be frustrated with the standard of the rooms offered to guests. The location of the Hotel is great, part of the Rogers Centre complex, handy to the Toronto Convention Centre. We moved after a couple of nights to the Marriott Residence Suites on Wellington as the Renaissance was fully booked and we were much happier there, should have booked our whole stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Scott Z
Reviews.Content: Great customer service and the most consistently performing among all the Marriotts I stay at - even the Ritz in Manhattan, Orlando and Toronto do not compare. Consistency of customer experience across all staff (from the door, to the counter, to the bar, to the management) is a highlight for me and the only time I stay somewhere else is if it is sold out. The only reason i don't give it a 5 is because the bathrooms are somewhat dated - but they are clean. The bedding is always very nice. Oh yeah, you cant beat the location either.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: pdajunkee
Reviews.Content: Lobby small but room was nicely setup. Price was decent compared to the other big names in downtown Toronto. Great restaurant district just around the corner. CN Tower and Union Station just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “It's big and it's beige”
Reviews.Author: Dave F
Reviews.Content: A very large and pretty good hotel. The (actually quite good) bar has a view of the baseball stadium. The bedrooms are strangely huge. There's a big indoor swimming pool but it looks like an underground car park. I was up on the 11th floor but my colleagues lower down said that their rooms were noisy (mine wasn't). The only downside is that the whole of the indoors of the hotel is a beige-y yellow colour

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: sunshineliz
Reviews.Content: In a good location in downtown Toronto. Staff friendly, rooms spacious and clean and pool pleasant. Good view over the Rodgers Stadium. Exactly as you would expect. I was on the second floor and there was a function the first night - luckily it didn't disturb me but if you sleep lightly, avoid this floor with the function rooms. There was a wait to check-in as reception were busy, but they moved the people ahead of me quickly. Overall you wont go far wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Way to See A Jays Game ;)”
Reviews.Author: Jennylo80
Reviews.Content: I rented a 2 floor suite overlooking the Roger's Centre for my boyfriend's birthday last week, and it was AMAZING! The room was modern, had tons of room for all our guests (10 of us in total) and the bed along with the 2 pull out couches were very comfortable. The windows both on the main floor, and upstairs bedroom were floor to ceiling, which provide and amazing view of the game, and on the lower level the window is open, which allowed the boys to catch a few balls that a pitcher threw to them during practice :) The valet parking is the way to go I think to avoid hassle of downtown parking, and at only $30/night it's actually very reasonable for Toronto. The front desk staff were awsome, very helpful and polite. The room was an awsome gift, everyone had a great time, and I think it will be an annual event now!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: prfrison
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Renaissance Toronto Downtown Hotel last weekend. We had an extraordinarily spacious room and the hotel was very claen. It's a bit pricey, but then again it is right downtown, it's attached to the Rogers Center, and it's steps from the CN Tower. If you go, ask them about the daily food and beverage discount. That was a pleasant surprise when we got there, but if they give it to you, make sure your understand ALL of the rules pertaining to that specific discount or you may not maximize your savings on the promotion. Overall, a very, very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad when a match is on”
Reviews.Author: WeeChancer
Reviews.Content: If you are lucky enough to get a room with a view of the baseball/footbal, then the match view is great - the downside is the noise all night as they clean up/re-configure the pitch. Restaurant is bleak and no free WiFi - given the cost of the rooms, that is poor

Reviews.Title: “Stadium & Hotel in One”
Reviews.Author: VivaLaVacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference. I was a pleasant surprise to find out the hotel is attached to Rogers Centre Stadium. You can watch the Blue Jays play from the hotel lounge. Very nice bonus. They also have guest rooms which look out into the stadium. The staff was wonderful and the hotel is modern and sleek. The CN Tower is right next door and the Metro Convention center is less than a 5min walk away. I got an awesome rate using my Amex Card. I highly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service Compensated for Renovations Disaster Zone”
Reviews.Author: watson_cee
Reviews.Content: Overview: I stayed at the Renaissance on a hot weekend in July 2011, and had the unfortunate luck of getting one of the rooms on the renovation floor. Not only did the whole floor smell like plastic burning, filled with a haze reminiscent of the smog outside, but the carpet was ripped up all along the hallway. And on top of it all, the humidity permeated from the outside into the rooms, And if decor matters to you, then expect an early 1990s bright pastel-coloured, Caribbean mosaic feel. I hope this motif changes with the renos. Luckily, the service was top-notch, as I will explain below. Aveda products in the bathroom. Process: After checking-in, parking the car, and getting the key to my room, I walked and walked into what seemed like the bowels of the hotel. It smelled bad, carpet was all torn, there was a haze...apocalyptic by the standards of a major hotel chain. My room was the furthest room possible from the elevator (and it surprised me as to how far that actually was...I walk a lot so have no problem with the exercise but this seemed really really far). After that walk, my key did not work. I tried every trick in the book, but to no avail. So I trudged back through the stinky, hot hallway and back down to reception. I explained my situation that the key did not work and the concierge acknowledged this error and gave me a new key. So I went through the motions again and this time, the key worked. But boy do I wished that it hadn't. It smelled so absolutely horrible, that I knew I couldn't sleep there. I went back down with my bags, and explained the situation to the concierge. I was prepared for the worst but what do you know, she upgraded me to the "Club" floor. That was really unexpected. At best, I thought I would get another room on one of the floors under renovations. But she apologized profusely for the inconvenience and the smells and such. We got upgraded to a fantastic room with a king-sized bed, awesome view, and best of all, it was clean and didn't stink. The floor itself was decent...nothing to write home about, but at least it had carpet and didn't stink. On our way out for supper, the same concierge came over and asked us if everything was okay, and if we had everything we needed. It actually seemed like she cared. AREA: Went out to a few clubs on the weekend and found it very safe to walk back from the Entertainment district. It's part of the Skydome/Rogers Centre and from the restaurant on the main level (and the foyer of each of the floors I'm guessing), you can actually see inside the venue. They were setting up from the U2 concert during my stay there - pretty impressive view. -took me 15 min to walk to Yonge and King. -took me 20 min to walk to Yonge and Dundas CONS -some rooms are located really far from the elevators -parking lot is a bit hard to navigate to if you're not familiar with the area (though access to the parking lot from the hotel is an elevator ride...but having to park your car there is a bit of a trek) -expensive parking (but on par with downtown Toronto I suppose) - a bit "recessed" from the downtown core (though only a short walk away) PROS -Great location, and I found it cheaper than other hotels (chain or boutique) right around or on King/Queen/Front Streets. It was a short walk to the entertainment district (5 min) and about 20 minutes to the Eaton Centre at Yonge & Dundas. -Superior service. They addressed my issues without hesitation, and to my satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night”
Reviews.Author: andy c
Reviews.Content: Many of our friends were staying for a wedding.& we all found the accomodations top notch.The staff in all areas & especially the front desk personnel were very friendly & helped us find many of the sites of the city.The bar over looking the Dome was a great place to watch a ball game.The beauty of the hotel is that everything including some fabulous restaurants are all in walking distance.We have recommended the hotel to many of our friends that live out of town & love to come to T.O for concerts & sports events

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rhonda8791
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel for a few reasons. The location was great, we went for the Film Fest and everything was in walking distance.BUT the staff is what won me over, they were excellent! They were both helpful and friendly, all of them (that's important to me). The rooms we slightly more than average, but spacious. The view of the ball park is beyond beautiful, we didn't have a room with a view, but the bar/restaurant in the lobby has the best vie and great drinks and food. There's restaurants close by and the subway station are also close by, just in case you need to go a little further out and don't want to drive. I was very impressed; this will be my hotel of choice next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for a base ball game”
Reviews.Author: dorothy0
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night to watch a base ball game rather than wrestle with a five year old in the stands. We had a room that overlooked the ball field. The windows open so you can hear and see everything as if you were sitting in the stands. This was great family fun for our two boys. There was something always going on in the stadium to watch before and after the game. Preparing the field, cleaning the stands, practice, etc. The lights were on in the stadium all night so you could see everything that goes into cleaning before the next game or event. The hotel offers food and drink packages, at a very reasonable price, for watching the game from your room. The pool at the hotel was also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wear your running shoes to get through this baseball hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Glamazon1123
Reviews.Content: I'm sure that if I were a jays fan I would have been in love with the view from one of the field view rooms or from the very small bar overlooking the Rogers Centre. However, I was in town to see friends and wanted a central location. While the hotel itself is relatively easy to get to, once you get inside it's marathon time! The elevators are centrally located in the lobby but once you reach your floor be prepared to lug your bags for miles as the corridors go on and on and on! our room was so bare it was a joke! Only the utilitarian will appreciate the decor. The bathroom was in need of some sprucing up and the sleep number bed...didn't work! This is a fine hotel if you're passing through and need some place to crash but if you're in Toronto looking for a comfortable home base, this is not the place to go!

Reviews.Title: “Fiance's 30th”
Reviews.Author: Liisa Y
Reviews.Content: My fiance is a HUGE Jays fan and we have been travelling to Toronto at least twice a year from 6 hours north (New Liskeard) and we always stay at the Renaissance! We LOVE it !! Within walking distance to everything (Eaton's Center, restaurants, downtown shopping) and the amenities and spa are fantastic !! We will continue to stay at the Renaissance!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location at Rogers Centre”
Reviews.Author: U2june
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance since I was attending an event at the Rogers Centre. The location was perfect, and the staff were very helpful. The on site restaurant was a great place for breakfast and late night snacks. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel could use some updating!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Beach_Baby
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for our anniversary last November 2010. The Front Desk staff were very friendly and accomodating and actually gave us a free upgrade to a loft room overlooking the rogers centre field. However, this hotel actually shows its age and it needs some serious updates like carpets and furnitures. The elevators are sooo small.

Reviews.Title: “I give it 4 out of 5!”
Reviews.Author: greekmom99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance hotel which is located in the Skydome for 1 night in August since I was attending Fan Expo. When I booked this hotel, I was mistakenly given 1 king size bed. I called and got it corrected. The Customer Service Rep was very helpful to find me a room with 2 doubles. Upon arrival, my husband checked in with the kids and found it a breeze. Parking is 20$ off site and 30$ for valet. We chose the valet option since parking off site is FAR. The hotel is located in downtown Toronto. I found the front desk staff really friendly and helpful to advise how to get to Timâ€™s for breakfast, to the MTCC (very close by and thanks for not laughing at my costume!) or to the convenient store to pick up some food for the convention. We got a city room view. The room was a very good size considering you are in a hotel in downtown Toronto. The room had 2 double beds, television, microwave and bar fridge. The room was clean and the bathroom as well was spacious and had wonderful Aveda products to use. The beds were comfortable and to my surprise â€“ I got a good nightâ€™s sleep. I have to add that we also had dinner in the lounge where you can overlook the baseball game playing in the Skydome. Not a big fan of baseball, but I really enjoyed myself sitting there with my husband and kids watching the game. I have to say itâ€™s more fun watching sports live than on television. The food was also really good. The only reason that I gave it 4 out of 5 instead of a full 5 is because when we were in the room, one of my kidâ€™s toys rolled under the bed, along with the toy I also found an Advil pill (not ours). So a bit more care when vacuuming is needed. Other than that, a really enjoyable stay. I highly recommend this hotel and will certainly stay there again next year!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kittykat99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2010 and got our room through hotwire. We have stayed in at least 10 downtown Toronto hotels over the past 3 years and this is our favourite (except the Royal York at Xmas which was very special). If you are a sports fan, you will love its location right next door to ('in') the stadium. There breakfast buffet was fabulous and room service good too. Our room was beautiful and clean, and all the staff friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Second home”
Reviews.Author: karpm
Reviews.Content: I"ve written several times to commend the staff of the Renaissance (Skydome) on their outstanding service. My wife was with me during my last stay, (Aug 8-Sept7) and she was extended the same courtesy and kindness; from the doormen, Waren and Jimmy, front desk, Jennifer, Lucy Anne, and particularly from Bethane and Tatiana in the club lounge. I continue to appreciate the daily pleasantries that make life away from home more like home. A couple of comments. Exercise bicycle (recombetent) was out of service for the entire month. Carpet's looking old.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location almost compensates for lack of everything else”
Reviews.Author: Canada365
Reviews.Content: Several of us stayed here at the end of August for the (awesome) Fan Expo Canada at the nearby Toronto Convention Centre. The location of the hotel is very convenient for access to several touristy places like the CN Tower, and easy on/off access to major highway routes (Canada's Wonderland was an easy drive north about 25-30 minutes when there is minimal traffic), easy access to oublic transit and great access to downtown restaurants and nightlife We were also able to enjoy the lounge and restaurant in the hotel with fantastic views of the baseball games in the Rogers Centre. The average room, rooms our group all occupied, were very tired and somewhat noisy. In fact, I dont think anyone should have to stay in a room like the one my son and I stayed in. But, perhaps that what you get if there are alot of celebrities staying in your hotel (for the Expo). The food in the restaurant and lounge was average to poor and very expensive' and that's saying something as I have no problem eating at McDonalds! The dinner menu is in really serious need of an overhaul. The bar area is very nice though, with great staff and a good selsction of drinks. It's not in my nature to go on about the negative, so I wont say too much more about the rooms I have experienced at this hotel - I should mention this is the second time I have stayed at this hotle, having stayed here last year. So, while I dont find the rooms anything to look forward to, I may stay again as long as it stays at least as clean as it is currently and I need to be in that location. I should note, too, that free wi-fi is only available the lobby which is kind of pathetic. Even the celebrities at the hotel had to hang out in the lobby to access free wi fi (good for us celeb watchers though!). The pool area is rather out of the way, and you actually have to through the lobby of this busy place to get there, and drag your soggy body back through to get to the elevators. But it is a nice size pool area, with a good looking fitness facility and a quiet hot tub. I believe there are 2 banks of elevators, one for each area of the hotel with access to different floors. I recall staying in the area behind the lounge/restaurant last year when I was in town for the Expo. Rooms may have been slightly more updated in that area, but not exciting or updated. In summary, I would stay here again ONLY for the convenience of being near to the Expo convention I was attending and only if the rest of my party was also staying here. They need to update the rooms, the menu and get with the times and offer free wi-fi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, massive & comfortable beds, and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jake F
Reviews.Content: Booked in here through hotwire so got a good deal on the rooms. The front of house staff are pretty nice and provided maps and dining suggestions. It was a bit of a trek to our rooms from the elevator, but when we got there we were pleasantly surprised by how large they were, on a split level, with large windows and an even larger (very comfortable) bed. Its main attraction, I suppose, is its direct proximity to the Rogers Centre, and it is cool to be able to look out over the field from the bar. However, this does mean it is a bit of a walk to the centre of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except for no free Internet in room!”
Reviews.Author: JimMain
Reviews.Content: We had a blast at this hotel! Caught two baseball games (Rays won both!) and you can't beat the location. Our AAA rate included 48 dollars each day from noon in the hotel restaurant. There was an event in town this weekend and we ran into Larry Hagman and Barbara Eden in our restaurant. Larry was very gracious and allowed us to take photos (we waited outside). Barbara wasn't as nice. All in all, we would stay there again. Also, we got a free upgrade to a junior suite for being silver elite. It didn't face the field, but we were okay with that since we had tickets!

Reviews.Title: “Going to a Jays Game? Have they got a deal for you....”
Reviews.Author: GeoTheo77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Hotel in downtown Toronto a couple of weeks ago. I booked the Blue Jays package (100 level seating) which included a nice room with a king bed and a good view of the downtown core. The package also included 2 seats to the Blue jays game and a credit for $48 for breakast, room service or for use in the lounge.On top of it all that, valet parking in an underground parking lot. We have stayed at other hotels in downtown Toronto for the same amount, and did not receive the same value as we did at the Renaissance. We were very happy with the excellent seats provided for the JAYS game and used the $48.00 credit for a good buffet breakfast. All this for just over $300 dollars. A great deal in an pricey area of the city. I would recommend this package for any out of town baseball fans going to a game or a series.

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you are going to Skydome”
Reviews.Author: Fitch7600
Reviews.Content: This hotel is attached to Skydome, or Rogers Centre, or whatever it's called this week. a few rooms look out over the field, but even the ones that don't are spacious and comfortable, set up in a mini-suite style. Many have jacuzzi's with a separate stall shower, and the usual comfortable Renaissance bed. The lobby restaurant and bar has a great view of the field and is a fun place to watch batting breakfast. If you are a frequent Marriott guest with executive access, there is a sixth floor lounge. The set-up is a little strange in that it's in the middle of the floor rather than a stand alone room, but the refreshment options are definitely above average, especially at breakfast. Two things that could be better: No wifi in the hotel, so you are tethered to ethernet at the desk, though it's a decent speed. Also, be aware that depending on your room location, the walk from the elevator can be quite a hike.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Canam778
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. We had tickets for a Blue Jays game so it was an extremely convenient location. Check-in was fast with a very friendly staff. Self parking is a little hard to find. It is under the Rogers Centre with paarking close to hotel elevator. We were on the 11th Club floor with a City view. The room was very large, clean, with a comfortable bed. Though the bathroom was clean and modern, the lights over the vanity gave little light(sometimes that's a good thing in the morning for some of us). On the downside, internet rates are obscene, however the lobby is WiFi. The location is close to the Convention Centre and good restaurants. A nice reduced summer rate was a bonus. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for baseball fans!”
Reviews.Author: megrey
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all the amenities, business features, and comforts that I expect from a Renaissance, but it's attachment to the Rogers Centre makes it special. A bar/restaurant in the lobby area looks right over the field. Some of the rooms also look out over center field (higher room rate, obviously). My regular room was great. My meeting was in the hotel and we had some of the best meeting food ever - definitely above expectations. All around, a great experience. Definitely recommend for business and pleasure. Also, if you are a fan of Porter Air (as I am), you can literally walk to the hotel from Porter's airport (took us about 20 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Great space and neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lokiluvsj
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and the staff was great! Very attentive and quick to respond to inquires. The neighborhood is filled with lot's of restaurants and is walking distance to the CN tower and the beautiful Queens Quay and ferry to the Islands.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Renaissance unless you like loud, drunk sports fans.”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynRider
Reviews.Content: This place is billed as the "Toronto Renaissance". As a Marriott God Reward member, this is probably the worst Renaissance hotel I've stayed in during my years of traveling. It is not the "Toronto" Renaissance. It is the "Rogers Arena" Renaissance - and that changes everything. Like all Marriott Rewards profiles, ours lists our room preferences. This includes non-adjoining rooms. Receiving an adjoining room should have been our first solid sign that this was going to be a rough ride. Naturally, the Toronto Blue Jays had back-to-back games during our visit; therefore, the hotel was housing families with kids running up and down hallways, playing in elevators, or traipsing through the lobby soaking wet after a swim in the pool. Another core customer base were the loud drunks - both before and after the games. This included the folks on the other side of our room's adjoining door. This room was housing more than two drunk, loud adults and they in turn had the doors open for a floor party between a number of other rooms. The noise level was insane and it went on all night. We called the front desk and, after no response, headed down to the front desk. Ultimately, we had to move to another room. Take note of that again: WE had to move to another room - in the middle of the night. The restaurant (or any restaurant for that matter) that qualifies a hotel as "full-service" was closed for the entire time we were there. After a long day touring in the city, we decided to go to the health club facilities to swim in the pool. We arrived at pool level and were surprised that we could hear the stadium crowd from inside the health club. We were wrong - it was the cacophony being generated by the overflow crowd in the pool. The pool was overcrowded beyond belief. No adjectives can adequately describe the insane amount of people, the noise, and the complete pigsty the changing rooms were. The hot tub, which probably could seat four adults comfortably had eight people in it. That would be five people crammed on the underwater benches and three overweight adults squatting in the middle of it. Observing all of this from the top of the stairs descending into the pool area made me think of one thing: there was not enough chlorine in Ontario to control the germs in this overflowing petri-dish-of-a-pool. This hotel does not meet the quality, service and amenity levels that I have come to associate with a Renaissance. While my complaints are about other guests, I think it is the responsibility of the management to preserve the brand and provide guests with an experience equivalent to the cost. This hotel is a complete rip off. If for some reason you can't help but stay at this hotel, I have to draw your attention to the hallway wallpaper. I've never been moved to comment on wall coverings before, but this place deserves a mention. On the two floors we were housed on, the hall way wallpaper created an impression that the walls were made of cinder blocks. I don't think I've ever seen a more bizarre wall cover selection in all my travels. It gave the guestroom halls a look that was something of a cross between inner-city elementary school and county jail. Also note that the "Harbor Front" is wildly overrated. Travel guides universally recommend the area, but I don't see the appeal. The restaurants were lousy. The place was deserted and it seemed to be another city trying to bring life to the waterfront. Unless there is a concert scheduled or art show underway, it is dismal. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: armeegurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a race we were doing in Toronto. We were pleasantly surprised that we were given a room with an inside view. There were no baseball games but there was the Ontario Varsity Football Finals, so it was fun to watch from our room - the glass windows opened right up and when we closed it, the noise was cut right down. The front desk staff were very friendly, the concierge helped us to find where we were racing from and the best place to catch the TTC. The room was clean, beds were super comfy, big bathroom and the cleaning ladies were extremely friendly and helpful. We ate at Arriba and had the quesadillas and chicken sandwich and they were awesome, although the food is a little pricey. The waiter was extremely nice and he was the only one on staff but kept a smile on his face and kept everyone happy. The location of the hotel is great if you are going to a Jays game, but for staying in downtown, there are closer hotels to other amenities. The price was great and that's why we chose it, it was also super close to the Gardiner to get onto when we left. Parking was $20 which I thought was great for Sat and Sunday. They need to get something else inside the Rogers Centre to wake the building up, I was told that the Hard Rock closed down because they just weren't busy enough and it's pretty quiet if there isn't anything going on. Overall, great stay, good staff do make a difference and I would stay there again for the price.
