Reviews.Title: “Outstanding views, to top off a great stay”
Reviews.Author: WON2301
Reviews.Content: A great trip and stay at the Toronto Downtown Hotel, definetly recomended for Jays fans!

Reviews.Title: “Felt welcome. Stellar staff. It has its perks...”
Reviews.Author: Hidntreshr
Reviews.Content: First of all, I wasn't going to give a rating at all until the night manager went above and BEYOND the call of duty to call a cab for me (on the hotel's dime) when I had to go to the hospital late one Saturday night. That was unexpected and VERY appreciated. The staff continued to be incredible throughout the entire stay. The cleaning folks did an immaculate job. I hung the "No Service" card in order to get the daily offer of $5 in dining coupons (if you skip housekeeping services), but she/he still came in to tidy up and refresh the toiletries, towels, and write a thank you note for my tips. The reason why this doesn't get a very good is because it wasn't until halfway through my stay that I found out my Rewards membership made me eligible for free internet. The internet in the room is wired, not wireless, so it caused about 5-10 guests at any given time to sit in the lobby (where there is wireless) and bond. It sorta had a nice community feel to it-- I don't know that the hotel did this intentionally. Perhaps. But I'd have rather had wireless in the room, a pool on a higher level (its in the windowless basement though they creatively use lighting to make it feel less suffocating), and have a prettier view than the dismal train tracks. Those few things aside, I'd possible stay again just because the staff rocks. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. slightly dated and tired”
Reviews.Author: needvacationah
Reviews.Content: Location very convenient and within walking distance to several downtown Toronto attracations (CN Tower, Air Canada Center, Rogers Arena, Waterfront, Via Rail Station, Spadina streetcar, Hockey Hall of Fame). Front desk staff and restaurant staff were courteous. In past Marriott establishments, the cleaning room staff or staff members you would pass in the hallways always made an effort to look you in the eye to say hello. This was not the case at this hotel. Booked a AAA rate which included breakfast, therefore the value of the room was <$120. The Breakfast Buffet cost for adults was a bit steep considering what was included - $16.95 for scrambled eggs, omelets, sausages, bacon, potatoes, juice, cereal, bread/bagels/muffins, coffee, juice. Kids buffet was $6.95 for 12 and under and was a good value. Was able to catch the end of a football game one evening because the restaurant windows face the inside of Rogers Arena. Hallway and room carpets were dated. Bedding, room furniture and washroom was also dated but in good shape. Bed was comfortable. Rooms were quite from inside and outside noise. City view faces the railway tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: gopoets
Reviews.Content: The hotel is connected to the Rogers Centre so the location for Blue Jays or Argos games can't be beat. Our room directly overlooked the field so it was awesome. The room itself was just OK as it showed some wear and tear. The hotel has a decent fitness center and the restaurant/room service was satisfactory. Its only a few blocks to some nice Toronto restaurants, the CN Tower is right next door and the Hockey Hall of Fame is a few blocks away. The location is clearly the best aspect of this place.

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons - Make requests...”
Reviews.Author: MrIanM
Reviews.Content: Bit of a mixed bag this one. The staff were ok, but the maintenance and room distance wasnt. The room wasn't bad with a view of the bottom of the CN Tower, but it was MILES away down maze like corridors, quite possibly the furthest away they could have put us, even though we politely asked for a field view, was turned down then seemingly punished for asking!? Both mornings between 8-9am we were disturbed/woken by maintenance going on either in the room next door or above and had to call reception to ask them to stop. The location is fantastic though, being right there for the baseball and only a 5/10min walk from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had spent longer in this hotel room”
Reviews.Author: ljsmith35
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised to find we were upgraded after booking a very special rate of $119 on a Sunday night... had booked a room for a friend visiting for England as well. Not sure if it had to do with the U2 concert playing the next night but they put us in the first floor 2 level suites. These rooms were huge and beautiful. We had a full living room, small kitchen area and a separate bedroom and full bathroom with a big soaker tub upstairs. Only complaint is the bathroom, although nicely decorated, showed it's age a bit. Hotel was clean, very comfy, spacious... awesome location if visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest Baseball Game Ever!”
Reviews.Author: anne170
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of a package deal offered by the Renaissance; We got a room with a view from the outfield of Stadium plus two tickets to the game played that night. It was like having a bedroom in the upper deck of a baseball stadium. We watched batting practice in the room then went downstairs to the stadium for the game. This was a once in a lifetime adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloLake
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location. Staff friendly. Can walk to a lot of attractions and access to public transit. Love the buzz around it - especially when it is game day!

Reviews.Title: “Great family experience at a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ottawaliam
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay in early August. The hotel is modern and clean with great amentities, particularly for families. The location is ideal for walking - we parked the car and toured the downtown easily on foot, streetcar, and subway. The pool facility was great and the staff were friendly. Although our room didn't overlook the stadium, the view from the lobby was popular with all the kids in the hotel. During our stay, they were preparing the field for a football game - fascinating to watch. We booked through a bidding site and I truly believe we got incredible value for what we paid. The staff were really nice to our young son, always chatting him up when we passed through the lobby or in the elevator. I had contacted the hotel ahead of our stay to address concerns other posters here had noted about noise from the train tracks. Our room ultimately faced the tracks and there was no noise problem at all. Overall a great experience and I would stay here again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room!”
Reviews.Author: julesrussell
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Renaissance. We stayed in one of the big rooms that had a sitting room and a seperate king room - heaven! We had a great view of the CN Tower. The staff was so friendly. We loved the all you can eat breakfast! My mom has stayed in one of the rooms that overlooks the field and absolutely loved it! Will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Leenda1970
Reviews.Content: Paul the concierge was soo very helpful and delightful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service!!”
Reviews.Author: TOgirl1
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Toronto. It is centrally located and close to all attractions. The service was top notch and our stay couldn't have been better!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loriesco
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed at this hotel last weekend. It was very clean and accommoddating. We had asked for an early check in as we were going to a Jay's game, and because we had got there before check out time from the previous night they were unable to accommodate. (totally understandable) However they validated our parking so that we wouldn't have to pay 2 parking fees, which was great. Once we finished at the game we checked in and asked for the highest floor possible. We were given the top floor which was nice. The room was great. King size bed with a fridge and Keurig coffee machine. We had housekeeping check up on us at least 3 times the first day, just to make sure we had everything we needed. They had a nice pool there and jacuzzi, which was a bonus. I love to go for a swim first thing in the morning. We ordered breakfast in bed and it was nice as well. A little pricy but nice to treat yourself every now and then. I did book this room through Hotwire. After booking the room I went on the hotel's website to find out some info. However I also found out that I could have got the room cheaper through the hotel website :( No big deal. You live and you learn. Overall I would definately reccommend this hotel and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: ChathamTraveller
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and unusually spacious! Sleeping is very quiet with the old school, thick, walls - great for a good nights rest. Hotel is next to the CN tower and part of the Rogers Centre. On game night you can eat or drink in the restaurant and watch the game. Hotel staff are top notch - always greeted with a friendly smile!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Fieldview Room”
Reviews.Author: mlevai
Reviews.Content: The fieldview room was great. We werenâ€™t in Toronto to see a game, but it was pretty cool to watch the workers putting the field back together after the U2 concert. The room was very spacious with a king bed, cabinet with refrigerator, desk and chair, chair and ottoman, and large (but dated) bathroom. Very convenient to the lakeshore, theatres, Second City, CN Tower -and obviously the Rogers Centre. Really enjoyed our two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time....”
Reviews.Author: drabick
Reviews.Content: They moved my baseball tickets around so i could see more games..I have stayed many years and will go back again.. Some of the staff are like my family..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location attending ball game at Rogers Center”
Reviews.Author: kcooman
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed and excellent 5th floor room facing the city for a weekend night while in Toronto to see the Yankees play the Blue Jays. This Marriott hotel is essentially part of the Rogers Center building, so the stadium gates are literally within yards of the hotel lobby. (Rooms on the stadium side would look into the stadium, as do the windows from the restaurants in the hotel.) Check in was smooth and efficient. Our quiet, king bed room also had a pull out sleeper sofa, two flat screen TVs, and desk. Room is modest in size, with two large windows facing the city, and overlooking the main rail lines coming into Toronto. Only a five minute walk south from hotel down to the lakefront eateries and harbor walk, and five to ten minutes walk north to the main theatre venues along King Street. The value for us was outstanding, as we were using our free Marriott night. We parked in a garage nearby for $25 a day, but there is also valet parking at the hotel itself. Plenty of places to eat at all expense levels and styles within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Gift”
Reviews.Author: t3anders
Reviews.Content: We bought my father a room with a view of the stadium so he could watch his favourite team in action. When we arrived, we inquired about upgrading him.. They were more than accommodating and offered us a bi-level room with so much space. Having my 2 year old nephew present for this even meant that he had even more room to explore while we sat and watched the came in comfort. Everyone at the hotel was incredibly friendly and went out of their way to ensure that we had a great time. The Front Desk Manager even escorted us to the room to make sure it was to our liking. I highly recommend this hotel esp on game day. I called approx 1/2 a dozen times to make sure everything was perfect for my father and every time I called, I was greeted with someone warm and reassuring. I think my father is still smiling over this day. Thanks Renaissance for making an already memorable day, magical.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...we loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: ladyjanesta
Reviews.Content: Went through Travelzoo deal. Great place to stay, close to everything.The restaurant was great. enjoyed over looking Blue Jays Field well we ate. Food price fair and tasted well. Stay on the 6th floor...The room was large and very clean. Loved the K-Cup machine in the room. The bathroom is very large with two sinks. Very clean and Bright. Lots of personal touch too. Staff very friendly. We will go back! The breakfast in the club lounge was awesome...very helpful staff there. Loved the fact snack were available during the day. Pool was very nice to. Went to Jays game had lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “In the top ten things i've ever experience”
Reviews.Author: Fenwayfranatic
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto to see a concert & a ball game . We had a room overlooking the field it was awesome . To open your curtains and watch a ballgame was the coolest experience. On top of that the room was great and the bar and restaurant had a great view of the field. Who needs the beach! Seeing the roof open & close was cool too . A must for a true baseball fan . The Staff was on top of there game!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff & service!”
Reviews.Author: travelto35
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at the Renaissance in June to attend a concert at the Air Canada Centre. We were so pleased with the amazing service we received! From the moment we arrived, we were greeted warmly & genuinely. The front desk & front door staff were amazing and so personable. We were made to feel like family. We will absolutely stay there again for our next visit to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “The Renaissance hotel suites are most impressive allowing families to experience luxury as they stay to relax and enjoy spectaul”
Reviews.Author: KimBurgess
Reviews.Content: Our family and friends have enjoyed our stays at the downtown Renaissance on more than one occasion. The spacious suites are lovely and ideal for entertaining and the central location of the hotel makes for easy travelling around the city. We have enjoyed Toronto Blue Jay games, Disney on Ice and the Monster Jam as well as the CN tower with our children and friends during our stays. The restaurant overlooking the ball park at the hotel is unique as it allows for guests to enjoy dinner while enjoying events hosted at the Rogers centre. During our stays, we have been pleased with the hospitality and we look forward to future visits.

Reviews.Title: “A Renaissance Hotel -- in name only”
Reviews.Author: vigone
Reviews.Content: You come to expect a certain level of quality and service from a brand name hotel. In fact the Renaissance chain features and in-room video on the features of the brand throughout the world ---top notch hotels with enticing features. The Renaissance Hotel in Toronto is a Renaissance Hotel in name only. Basically it is a Marriott Hotel --nothing more. In fact -- when we checked in at 5 PM --- we went to our king size room on the Club Floor. Along the hallway were trays, cups, glasses that had been put out for pick up. Outside our room was a bucket of empty beer bottles. That same bucket was there when we checked out the next day. Also, in the bathroom (aged) there was no bath mat ---making the marble floor a danger when getting out of the shower. Although all Renaissance Hotels are smoke free --there was the odor of smoke in our room when we entered. For the price of the Renaissance there are other fine hotels in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location but lots of conferences going on.”
Reviews.Author: dannycooper
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and the bar is quite lively (being in view of the baseball field). Location is good; near to union station, the CN Tower and the Rogers Centre. The rooms could be a little more soundproof though, people walking in the corridor can wake you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michimi
Reviews.Content: I agree with another guest that this was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on. We regret not checking out the mattress tag so we could buy one ourselves. The service was excellent, both at the front desk and from cleaning staff who checked on us the first night to see if we needed anything else. Although you require reservations for the restaurant within the ballpark, there are great ballpark views from the other hotel restaurant and bar, Arriba. As far as we could tell you didn't need any special reservations in order to sit here, even during game time, and the food was great. We got an excellent rate on hot-wire, so my review is based on a very modest price point. Despite the comfort and quality, there weren't a lot of frills to this hotel so I probably would have downgraded this rating to a four if i had paid the full price (particularly for the pricey ball-park view rooms). They had Aveda bath products but the shower heads and water pressure were lacklustre, and there was some mystery orange "guck" on our bathroom wall which we didn't bother complaining about. Other than the guck, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no wi fi in the rooms is a joke at these prices”
Reviews.Author: tdcCT
Reviews.Content: Unique location attached to Rogers Centre. Reasonably good service, well maintained but no wi fi in the rooms is a joke at these prices. I've been in third world countries with better technology. They do have wired internet access for those that are technologically operating in the past. Would not stay here again unless the hotel provided a minimal level of technology like Cora's the breakfast spot nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: drakeNiagara
Reviews.Content: We will go back. Very clean and everyone is friendly. Every thing is easy to get to, shopping, places to eat and sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrMar
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Toronto from New Jersey for a Phillies road trip. The hotel location is perfect if you are taking in any event at the Rogers Centre. We stayed on the top floor (11th) with a decent view of the city side. Rooms overlooking the inside of the stadium are ridiculously expensive, especially if you have tickets to the game as well. We were pleased with the cleanliness of the room and the houskeeping staff maintained the room nicely daily. We were a little surprised that there was only one restaurant in the hotel, but after seeing all the fine dining establishments withing a couple blocks walk, it is not a problem. In fact, we never moved our vehicle from the garage during our entire stay. We did have breakfast in the hotel restaurant and were treated very well by our server, Teri. The concierge representative, Monica, was excellent in her dining recommendations. A very nice hotel if you should stay in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacularly Average”
Reviews.Author: crashingcanuck
Reviews.Content: This is one of those hotels where you imagine the environment and amenities are really top notch but while nicely equipped, this hotel only leaves one feeling satisfied, not impressed. The front entrance staff is 'cold', the rooms are slightly above average and the pool area lacks a sauna or a steam room. To be honest the pool area is more akin to a decent into a gray dungeon with artificial light and limited seating. The location remains this hotel's selling feature. A short walk to the waterfront or to Union Station is super convenient. If you can get a deal (less than $100 a night) then by all means go for it. If you are forced to pay more then I would reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “very rude front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: travellingman1955
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few months ago and the staff was excellent. The male, overnight manager (tall guy with dark hair) was VERY nice and went above and beyond to help make our stay satisfying. I recently visited the hotel again this past weekend, hoping to see the overnight manager again who was very helpful, but had to deal with the most rude, oblivious, "busy" staff I have ever seen. I waited over 10 minutes at the front desk to speak to an employee as she talked on the phone (which was definitely a personal phone call as i heard her gossiping about her weekend). The hotel was mediocre - nice if you are a Jays fan, but besides that has nothing else going for it. The stafff were AWFUL!

Reviews.Title: “A Wrap With A View”
Reviews.Author: LisaEight
Reviews.Content: We came, as most people I suspect do, for a game at the attached Rogers Centre. As I checked in I noticed my brother, daughter and nephew had vanished around the corner, entranced by the view of the inside of the ballpark from the lounge and restaurant. We dropped the bags in the clean, average looking room and then ate lunch before the game as we watched batting practice. It was awesome and the food was very good, I had a delicious veggie wrap and my brother had curry chicken on rice. For those who want to do the same, the lounge seats fill by 4pm but are pretty empty at lunch time, until around 3:00. Batting practice was later but you could see the field being prepped and some pitching going on. Also, the pool was quite lovely but buried within the very nice (but unused by me) health club. My kids could not find there way there without help, which was probably the point. Also, free internet was available only in the lobby, and you needed your own computer to use it--if you used their business center you had to pay. We had a package with very good Blue Jays tickets included, along with breakfast (which was a meal credit for any meal, actually) and valet parking--with this price we paid (299) was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “I have stayed here many times and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Deb8963
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the staff and accomations - quickly responded to every to every request. I have an I-Pad and would have loved wireless in the room instead of just the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrsfrancisco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for his birthday week last November. I must say, it is a good hotel and the location is the best if you have a business or shopping trip in the downtown Toronto area. We came in on a Sunday for the Toronto Raptors game that evening. They were able to check us in early and in no time. The room is very spacious and clean. The bathroom is huge, spotless and pretty. The view wasnt as great as we had hoped for the field view but it's still ok. The room service was prompt and fresh. All in all, it was a good stay. I would like to talk about the hotel's location. It is attached to the Rogers Centre, so it would be perfect if you stay here when there's a game. You can watch it right from your room. Also, i didn't realize it was right next to the CN Tower until we went there for a dinner for my husband's birthday. We walked to the tower and back in my heels. It was so close and the area was pretty secured and well lit. We didn't feel threatened at all. This hotel is also about 30 minute walk or less or a 5-10 minute cab ride to anywhere downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed WithThis Stay”
Reviews.Author: Etsie
Reviews.Content: Staff was universally great - friendly and helpful. No issues with cleanliness. But this hotel is really not up to Renaissance "upscale" standards especially if you were paying full price. We stay here for the Rogers Centre location. The property could use a good facelift/updating. Room decor is boring and not what you would expect from a high end property. Not even close to that of a Couryard by Marriott we stayed in on this same trip. Same for bathrooms and in room amenities. Buffet breakfast was a limited selection - much less than the regular Marriott we stayed on on this same trip. Bottom line - if you can get a good price, and do not have high expectations and appreciate the location than this hotel will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good but resteraunt disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: keenvisitor
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to 'giant suite' with a view of the CN Tower (and the rail line but we did not get noise). The suite was huge. You entered a large hallway with a huge bathroom (step-up jacuzzi tub, double sinks and large shower) on the left and a closet (the only one). Then you walked down the hall to the living area, with 2 sofas and 2 easy chairs, large TV, desk and coffee trables. A door and wall went most of the way across seperating off the bedroom. I must admit it was a bit of a hike to the WC in the middle of the night but the room was comfortable. There were plenty of towels and toilitries but the lighting in the bathroom was not very good for things like drying your hair or putting on make-up (pot lights near to the wall). The internet was reasonably quick but there were no notepads or pens for taking messages. We ate at the Arriba resteraunt one nght and it was fun watching the baseball game. However the food was nothing to get excited about - Dh had trout which he said was fine ($25) and I had a soup (so hot it blistered my mouth and I sent it back) and burger ($17 an o'k). Interestingly 2x .5lt of wine was roughly the same price as a .75lt bottle of the same wine? We slept well until we were woken by someone else's noisy fan. DH went to his meeting and I went down for an early lunch. Soup (manhattan chowder too oily to eaat) and club sandwich (lots of some type of sauce) $17 and a very good cappuchino. That night we decided to have a cocktail before going out for supper and had possibly the worst classic margarita ever (the next night we had a 'deconstructed' gin and tonic - much better. The best meal I had was breakfast. Our stay was pleasant and this hotel is right amidst all the attractions of downtown, however In my opinion it could be even better. What a waste to have people coming and buying a couple of drinks and sitting watching the ball game when they could have a really good resteraunt as well as a bar.

Reviews.Title: “Baseballin good time!!”
Reviews.Author: TAJacobsFamily
Reviews.Content: The Downtown Renaissance hotel in Toronto is the perfect place to stay whether you are there for business or pleasure. The rooms are classy and well laid out, and the view of the baseball field spectacular. Just make sure you time your stay so that it lines up with a Blue Jays home game!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly relaxing, great hotel, location, impeccable, everything to see in Toronto at your fingertips, couldn't ask for more,”
Reviews.Author: Mary19581
Reviews.Content: Want to visit again soon. Beautiful hotel in a terrific city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! Clean room! Needs updating. Concierge training required.”
Reviews.Author: EmpireEstates
Reviews.Content: We had plans for an event at Air Canada Center and also a Blue Jays game. This hotel was absolutely a perfect location for both events. We stayed in a King Suite with a great view, but annoyingly it was on the far side of the hotel. Room: New carpet. Very comfortable bed. Very spacious room. We both slept well. Bathroom needs updating. The marble had many areas of discoloration and the shower was generic. We have stayed at other Renaissances before and were expecting the same level of quality. Concierge: Understaffed. I would think that a hotel in this location would have at least two people working at a time, especially during peak hours. My husband and I were not pleased with the inadequate service provided. This is certainly an area that requires improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant family vacation - fun and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: ljohnston79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Toronto Downtown with our 6-year-old daughter. It was absolutely perfect because my husband could watch the baseball game from our window and my daughter could watch some of the game, watch a movie or just play in the mountain of luxurious pillows! On top of the great location and amazing room, the service was incredible! The gentleman at the front desk upgraded our room to be sure our family was comfortable and even dropped by later on to give my daughter an ice cream sandwich! The valet was curteous and very helpful when chatting about best routes to take out of the city and even remembered our names and chatted about the game with my husband. The entire staff was helpful and friendly - more than any hotel I've stayed at in Canada (and Canada is a pretty friendly place!) I can't say enough about this hotel - worth every penny for the location, service and experience!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: BadKtty
Reviews.Content: On a recent Saturday, my husband and I rode our bikes down to the Toronto waterfront from Richmond Hill, a 40K ride we've done before but we usually just turn around and take the subway/bus back north the same day. This time, we decided to stay the night downtown, go to a Jays game, and have dinner at Massimo Capra's lovely restaurant, Mistura. We used Marriott points to book the room and, to our delight, they gave us a beautifully appointed suite with a bathroom the size of a standard hotel room. The Renaissance Toronto is a lovely, grand hotel with a wonderful bar overlooking the baseball field (which I will forever call the Skydome!), and a number of rooms that also overlook the field. I've always loved what Marriott does with their Renaissance hotels, but this is one of their best renovations and restorations that I've seen. Everyone we encountered, from the front desk staff to the bell captain (who offered to valet park our bikes - ha) to the housekeepers, was friendly and provided outstanding customer service. Because it was booked on points, they could have put us in a small room with double beds but, true to Marriott style, they put us in that wonderful suite. This kind of over-the-top customer service, coupled with things like gifting me with a year of gold status after I was off the road for a year, make Marriott the top hotel brand in the world, in my former road-warrior view.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room”
Reviews.Author: Pens_Fan_67
Reviews.Content: We came on a free Marriott certificate night and got upgraded to one of the suites that overlooks the ballfield, which was perfect as we had come up to see the game.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: stuartcheryl
Reviews.Content: This Renaissance is fantastic. View of arena from the restaurant and rooms. Close to wharf, Chinatown, CN tower and shopping. They make you want to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome friendly service!!”
Reviews.Author: rosetoffeetoffee
Reviews.Content: This is my first review, but I felt I must write to tell about the friendly service from the front desk. The fellow who looked after me was genuine, thoughtful and very friendly. It was crazy busy when I arrived because of the home opener of the Blue Jays. The hotel was fully booked and they upgraded me to a stadium view room. It was awesome for the pre-game batting practice etc. (I already had tickets to the game). I have stayed at this hotel many times, and always receive a very friendly welcome. The rooms are very large, always spotless, the staff is very friendly including the housekeepers and the room service staff. (The food is very well done too!!) Parking is a bit awkward if it is really busy. If the valet is full, you will need to drive around the dome to the hotel signed parking. If the lot says it is full, drive in anyway. Just give them your name, tell them you are checking in and they will let you in. Overall a great experience. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: DonWyevaleOntario
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family and friends for daughter's wedding and loved the hotel .It was so quiet and the rooms were spacious so that we could all gather in one room and socialize. Breakfast buffet was excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, amazing staff...can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: kermark2011
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Renaissance Hotel, both times as a romantic getaway. The whole experience was great. The front desk staff were amazing and helpful - the Concierge was great at suggesting restaurants and fun things to do. Our room (both times) was incredible - really contemporary and clean and the bed was so comfortable. We had a great breakfast in the main restaurant before checking out. All in all, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: crlanglois87
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located centrally to the financial district, but also nar good nightlife and the ball park. Great service with the exception of the bar, where service was slow, but the food was good. I'll definitely stay there the next time I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the Entertainment District”
Reviews.Author: smoothrt
Reviews.Content: We were able to stay at this hotel for a nice deal and loved it. Interesting decor, great pool, and extremely convenient for baseball games or the CN Tower. Walked to and from other parts of downtown Toronto such as the Distillery District and around the Eaton Centre. They were long walks but dooable for people young and/or in shape. The room was a little dated and dusty but spacious. The service was very good and we would definitely look to stay here again if we visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!!”
Reviews.Author: n1kk1_km
Reviews.Content: I am quite fussing when it comes to standards but this place left me pleased even more everyday!!! We were having a special celebration so were upgraded to a fantastic room and given a little surprise with a bottle of wine. There was an error which left us Â£2 short and to make up for this the receptist offered us breakfast immediately, we were speechless at the offer! The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable, second to none and we do travel a lot. We went onto a five star exclusive resort in Mexcio and i couldnt help comparing the sleep quality which was not in the same league as this place. You cannot ask for a better location at that price. you are 20 foot steps from the CN tower, 5/10 minute walk to trains and nearby site seeing and collection point for trips - not to mention walking distance from the main shopping centre! Definately would recommend this without any ifs and buts or hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Fatnastic Service”
Reviews.Author: BaseballGetaway
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and inviting. The staff from the valet parking attendant who met us, to the front desk staff to the restaurant staff were all pleasant and did everything they could to make our stay great. We got the Blue Jays package and the hotel secured some fantastic seats for us - just behind first base and eight rows from the field. The restaurant credit more than covered our breakfast, we were also able to have drinks before the baseball while watching the Blue Jays take batting practice. Overall, a great birthday and romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the baseball fans!”
Reviews.Author: Lubiere
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms via PL for 90$ each. Check in was courteous and fast...although i was indicated on reservation that we got rooms with king beds (were 4 guys travelling), they did provided us with rooms with 2 beds on the 7th floor, so every one was relieved and happy. My room was a tad larger than the other, but both had large bathrooms, with double vanity, LCD TVs, Keurig coffee makers (2 cupulas provided), Aveena products. Beds were very comfortable. Our room had a small empty fridge which was very useful. Internet was 13$ a day, but did not use it. Free wifi in the lounge area. One thing about the design of this hotel is the rather long walk to the room in the corridors (the hotel wraps around the north side of the Rogers Centre). Also, the air conditioning was a tad loud in the room. The gym was quite impressive, with physiotherapy offered (I assume this is used by both baseball and football teams staying at the hotel) 3 elliptics, 3 treadmills, bikes, free weights, muscle machines. The pool which you access via the changing room, is one level down (so deep underground), and is quite large, good for laps. My friends used the restaurants (15$ breakfast, 20$ buffet, not bad price). We also used valet parking (30$ from check in till 1PM next day), with in out privileges, and prompt service. The outstanding feature of this hotel is easy access to Rogers Centre, obviously, but its a bit of a walk to the subway. However, if i get this again via PL, I shall be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sports fans with a touch of class”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: Due to my elite status, I was upgraded to a fabulous one-bedroom suite, overlooking the train tracks / city side. I couldnâ€™t fault the room â€“ it was huge and had one of largest bathrooms I have ever seen. It contained both a tube/shower combination and a separate walk-in shower. There was loads of space for toiletries beside the two sinks, as well as lovely Aveda products. The living room area contained a couch, two comfy chairs and a flat-screen TV. There was also a large table / meeting area in the corner of the room with a number of ergonomic chairs, which would be great for meetings. The bedroom area, separated from the living room by a half wall, contained a second flat-screen, a desk, and a huge Marriott king-sized bed, with the usual pile of pillows. While there was no Wifi in the room, the wired service was excellent (which was free to me as an Elite member). There is complimentary Wifi in the comfortable lobby. The room was very clean and quiet and we heard no noise from the trains. I loved the bed, but my partner found it a little soft. It was one of those suites that you never wanted to leave. I thought the location was excellent for sports fans, but a little out of the way compared to other Marriott hotels in the area. Saying that, downtown Toronto is very walkable and safe. Staff were friendly and approachable and both check-in and check-out was a breeze. The concierge lounge felt a little like an airport lounge â€“ soulless with a strange long design which followed the contours of the hotel. Food in the morning was fine and they had excellent bagels. The lounge had a few nibbles in the evening, although not the best Marriott concierge lounge I have every tried. I guess the only thing that let this hotel down for me where the corridors. I felt like I was in a prison as I walked to my lovely suite. The walls had orange wallpaper, in a brick pattern which was very weird and dated. I would give this hotel a solid 4 out of 5 stars for the rooms, but 3 out of 5 for the corridors. I would certainly go back just for the lovely suite, if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for baseball”
Reviews.Author: davidplustanya
Reviews.Content: Location makes it ideal to see the Blue Jays, which was the purpose of my trip. The hotel itself is pretty good as well. A huge plus for allowing medium/large sized dogs. Good service, clean, but rooms maybe a little on the small side. Would definitely recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Time for a Reno.”
Reviews.Author: 2FromTrona
Reviews.Content: Spent one night after a concert at the ACC. Booked the room on a discount site at a good price. Having said that if I'd paid their regular weekend price I would not be a happy camper. I doubt the place has had a major renovation since the SkyDome/Roger Centre opened - it shows. The corridors have a strange air freshener smell. Our room was large with a comfortable king sized bed but the wallpaper was peeling, the faucets leaked, carpet was worn and the TV was on its last legs. For the price we paid it was OK and on a positive note the location is good, the view into the stadium is quite unique and the breakfast was good (excellent coffee, good service, fairly standard buffet but it wasn't totally dried out like most hotel offerings). The recommendation is based on getting a room at a discounted price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Hethb
Reviews.Content: I can't fault anything really about this hotel (apart from the noise on occasion since it's next to a not so busy train line). On arrival I was greated by Lucy on reception who throughout my stay was professional and friendly. The hotel itself is in a great location but stepped back off the main road so not as busy as some of the others. It's also right next door to the Rogers Centre home of the Blue Jays Baseball Club and you can look over the arena from the bar and restaurant. My room was very large with a massive king sized bed and was extremely comfortable. The heater is easy to use and even in February when it was snowing I rarely had the heating on. The bathroom was a good size with a great shower. I couldn't work out how to use the TV for normal TV but I think that's a problem of mine rather than the system itself and I didn't have a lot of time for watching TV anyway. I ate in the bar one evening and the food was delicious. The staff are extremely friendly - something I've come to expect from Toronto anyway - and I didn't feel awkward eating alone. The breakfast the following morning was also very good. I would highly recommend the CN Tower and Ontario museum to leisure travellers. Also, if you get the opportunity take a bus ride around Toronto to see the different architecture - modern versus tradtional. I love this city and hope to go back again - I'd definitely stay in this hotel given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “it was like being a lab rat for a week”
Reviews.Author: teamtravelBolton
Reviews.Content: Check in. Poor. a really ru-lite ( so rude but with a smile if anyboby has watched come fly with me or little britain will know) I had read about the rooms trackside and the noise and asked the Blonde check in lady to not put us by the side of the track. Gues where we were put? you guessed it Track side. Wide awake at 5.00am each morning. I asked for another side of the Hotel but was told nothing was available as the Hotel was Full> Utter Rubbish, We were moved to another Trackside room but it still noisey. The Hotel is a maze endless Corridors swinging left and right. try this after a five am wakeup call. I became a little annoyed when I overheard staff saying how quiet the HOtel was. So much for being full. We had gone for a City Break and have come home totally exhausted and Drained. I also have a copy of the 12 Golden Rules of the Hotel chain. One of which lists as listen to your customers. Something they didnt do. I am writing to the head office. At checkout they didnt even ask if everything was o.k. I wonder why? Maybe because they knew we would complain about the noise levels. free Wi Fi - only in reception. very ppor. The poolside was awful. It was a grey dark area with a cold pool and spa. Nothing to look out of or at. The decor of the hotel was also pretty poor. very sparse with few pictures and the corridors were oppresive. On the whole one of the worst Hotels in the world I have stayed at. for this level expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, facility could use some upgrades”
Reviews.Author: ibookstore
Reviews.Content: I was here for the RIS convention Christmas weekend. Overall, I'd recommend this place any day of the week. Service was always excellent. The facility itself is quite nice, but you could see here & there little things that could use updates, e.g. a loose faucet in the bathroom, a slightly leaky tap in the bathtub. Also, our room stank a bit every time I walked into it, not sure if the carpet needed a good washing or what. Beds & pillows etc. were comfy. We had an interior view room (Blue Jays stadium). It was cool at first, and then the effect wears out quickly. I'd have preferred a nice outdoor view, with some natural sunlight coming in during the day, but ah well. I only used the restaurant for breakfast. It was good enough. Their buffet ran $15, which was an okay deal. They didn't have a huge selection though; and for some strange reason, they didn't cover up their sausage & bacon, whose aroma/odor I do not particularly like, so it made their breakfast serving area stink like high heaven. They did have a fresh egg cook, which was cool. Also Internet cost $12 extra per day. Definitely 4 out of 5 stars. A little tweaking & investment in facilities, and improvement in few areas, would make this a 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Free Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: aereedman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Toronto Downtown Hotel overnight on a Saturday whiile attending the Toronto Wine Show. Parking in the area amounts to self-parking a public lot next to the hotel and the hotel's valet service. Opt for the hotel's valet service; it's the same price and you don't have to walk up and down stairs to retrieve your car. Check-in was smooth and we received a free upgrade to a two-level suite with windows that offer interior views of the Rogers Centre. There was no game that day - probably why we got the free upgrade - but it was interesting. The lower level has laminate flooring, sofa, desk, mini-fridge and a bathroom that was in need of repair. The upper level had a nice king-size bed and a nicer bathroom. When we woke up in the morning there was no natural light as all the windows face into the Rogers Centre. I would have preferred a room with an exterior window rather than a view of artificial turf. The hotel is well located for dining and entertainment opportunities. The convention centre is close by as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitchwal1975
Reviews.Content: We stayed there as part of a wedding party, all the rooms were put together and the brides parents were upgraded to the game side (free of charge). The rooms were spacious, the bed was super comfy and the whole place was very clean. The only issue was the lighting in the bathroom...it wasn't very condusive to applying makeup, but the size of the bathroom was great for getting ready. Buffet breakfast the next morning in the restaurant was terrific and well priced. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enter the Labyrinth”
Reviews.Author: Ibn_Shisha
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel, but I would recommend asking for help with your bags when you check in, our you may never find your room! The location in a stadium makes for some interesting hallway layouts. For the most part, service was great, especially when we checked in - I happened to mention we had just driven all the way from Quebec City, and they upgraded my room? Valet service was a sometimes slow. I'm not sure about all the rooms (again, layout depends on the curve of the stadium), but our had a bathroom that was about as big as my apartment when I lived in Japan. The pool area was a little hard to find, and would benefit greatly from some windows and/or skylights.

Reviews.Title: “At rogers centre and CN tower - and the train station”
Reviews.Author: LippiNH
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hotel is directly at / in the rogers arena. From the hotelbar you can look into the arena. You can reach many places ba walking: the harborfront, financial district, hockey hall of fame, many museums and the CN tower. The rooms are regular and small, but clean. The train station is near the hotel, so you hear every train passing by the hotel. Parking is very expensive (20 CAD a day, 30 CAD for valet parking a day, but you have to get out the parking garage by 1pm, otherwise you have to pay etra 10 CAD till 6pm. For example: we arrived at 6.30pm and want to go out at 5pm the other day, so we have to pay add. 10 CAD, but we didn't even stay in the garage a whole day - that's not a good service!). Around the hotel are many public parking zones, 5-10 CAD/day. Internet is not free, we payed around 0,50 CAD/minute because we didn't have our notebook with us, printing is extra. Checking In for your flight is free. Wireless is also available, but you have to pay or register yourself or something like that.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: PoorPelvis
Reviews.Content: This trip was my birthday present to my husband (huge Jays fan.) Our first time staying at the hotel in Rogers center, we thought it would be great to have a field view room. It was great for about an hour then you realize that you will not see the light of day or breathe fresh air unless you go outside or they open the dome. It was convenient to stay in this hotel if you came to watch ballgames. The food in Arriba was really good, hot, and friendly staff. Even the room service came hot and served promptly. Check in and out was very quick, one of the quickest I've ever experienced. The room itself did not appeal to either of us. It is in need of renovations, and overall outdated. I was (and always am) surprised to see that this hotel (and all others that I have stayed at) have not evolved onto the low flush toilets. The bathroom was clean but not in the least modern. The tap in the tub always ran even when the shower valve was on. The moment you step off elevator onto your floor you get the sense of things to come. They really need to invest in paint and carpet for both hallways and rooms. Our next trip for the Jays vs Yankees series will be spent at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend Downtown Renaissance Toronto to friends & family”
Reviews.Author: Dylmeister
Reviews.Content: Looking for hotel close to Molson Amphitheatre while on budget. Was given this hotel as option on Priceline.Com. I was greeted courteously by desk clerk and asked to get a fridge. Our room was upgraded with living room on suite at no additional charge. Location was perfect as we visited the HHOF as well. Our concierge was very helpful and room service was very prompt (even at 10 minutes to close). Very relaxing room and everything was within walking distance. Overall had an excellent experience and would definitely stay at the Downtown Renaissance Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright.”
Reviews.Author: looniewise
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week. We chose this hotel because of the location, which was perfect for our purposes. A little underwhelmed as we expected a four-star hotel and yet the hotel furnishings were just okay. But the room was spacious and comfortable. Check-in and check out was smooth. Bell hop service was good when we arrived with our luggages. However, they appeared to ignore us in the following days when we approached the entrance - maybe they knew no tips if no luggages? There was a sporting event one night and we noticed quite a few rowdy guests in the lobby. But our room was nice and quiet. We had lunch at the restaurant a few times and enjoyed the food and service. All in all, this hotel was okay.

Reviews.Title: “WORST SLEEP EVER AND NOT ACCESSIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: jennykash
Reviews.Content: I have waited writing this review, in hopes that hotel management would get back to me to discuss my concerns. I left a comment card, left several messages for "Neve," and when I finally was able to speak with someone was told the General Manager would be calling on Friday (this has now been 2 weeks ago). When booking this hotel, I explained the situation of my husband's disability. He uses an electric scooter and we require wheelchair accessibility. The reservation lady assured us that there are highly valued accessible rooms and she indicated the hotel was very suitable. She proceeded to tell us about the beautiful pool area and wonderful W/C accessible rooms. Upon arrival, our room was NOT accessible at all. There was only 1 safety bar and there was a bathtub, which my husband is unable to use, as he needs a stand in shower with a seat. I explained this to the front desk and they were NOT accommodating at all. The hotel brags about a wonderful night sleep... The walls and doors are so paper thin you can hear EVERYTHING in the hallways. The first night we listened to a domestic dispute from 2 a.m. until 4:30 am. I called the front desk and the security guard came, knocking 4 times throughout 1 hour, telling the other guests to be quiet. Eventually they were removed from the hotel, but not until sleep was way past due. I heard EVERY detail about this fight, which was occurring in a room down the hall. The second night, we were awoken to the 2 am bar crowd, again making terrible noise throughout the halls. The third night, Justin Bieber's concert, again was sleepless. We spent $250/night for one of those nights! This hotel prides itself on being 4stars...I have had better night's sleep and service in many other budget hotels. We decided to check out the pool area, which the reservation lady had assured me was accessible for my husband. The access to this pool is a winding staircase, so my husband could not use it at all. I asked the front desk if there was an alternate route to the pool. She replied that there is a "bat cave" way there, but that she would not allow us to use it. We decided to try to get a W/C accessible taxi, as there was not much we could do at the hotel. We asked the concierge service for the contact information. She was quite rude, and then proceeded to give us 3 numbers to call...none of which worked for an accessible taxi and which I spent an hour trying to figure out who the correct person for me to talk to was. We travel frequently and I work in the travel industry. We are not picky and do not complain often. This was the worst stay, with the worst service, and the worst follow up care I have ever seen. I am still waiting for someone from the hotel to try to rectify this, as we are still completely dissatisfied. Three nights and $700 later... We feel we were totally lied to by the hotel, they did nothing to try to assist us in our stay. With accessibility being such an important part of today's time, this hotel should hang it's head in shame at how they react to patrons who are alternately abled.

Reviews.Title: “Not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: KitchaMitcha
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for a business trip because the rate was very competitive compared with the other downtown hotels. I booked for $190 CAD per night, AAA rate that was supposed to include continental breakfast. Upon check in, the continental breakfast evolved into a $48 food credit per night, with my choice of either restaurant or room service. That made the stay pretty reasonable for Toronto. The hotel is 3 blocks off King Street with its restaurants, and not far at all from Chinatown. I had no quibble with the room for a business stay. Everything was clean, the bed was super comfy, and the room was very light & bright. I wouldn't pick this for a romantic getaway with the hubby though. The bathroom was large, lots of towels and supplies, and my room had no issues with mold or anything like previously mentioned. However, my colleague said his room did have mold issues on the ceiling and tiles. I guess its hit or miss. There were two big drawbacks to my room. First, no safe. That meant I had to carry my passport everywhere with me. Second, the train tracks. As soon as I saw them out my window I knew that would mean trouble and I was right. The trains mercifully come a lot less frequently overnight, but they do still pass by and in my room on floor 4 every time one passed the window-the bed-my teeth all rattled. They gear up again bright and early around 7AM. I had my white noise app on my iPhone but it didn't really help. Getting a room on a high floor might. I used the gym twice. It is TINY with old equipment, but the treadmill worked and that's all I cared about. I had the gym to myself, and peeked my head in the pool room. It was empty too, which was a shame because it looked nice to me. Room service was not overly expensive, no irritating fees, and arrived on time and hot. Service was friendly. The food quality was typical room service, except their signature apple pancakes were just terrific. If you are looking for a hotel with lots of amenities (pool, gym, onsite parking, restaurant, etc) and don't mind the train noise then the Renaissance would be an okay choice IF you come across a great deal. If you get stuck paying the going rate there are definitely better properties all over the city where you can be guaranteed peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Overal Fun But Be Careful of Room Switch and Duplicate Charges”
Reviews.Author: pjalmtlansing
Reviews.Content: The room I booked through their reservations was not the room they gave me. This game-viewing room was a splurge to surprise my teenagers who said, "wow this is great, but where do we sleep" as there was only one bed. After being told by the front desk, "what do you want us to do," and me replying, "give me the room I booked months ago," the manager found us the correct room. Holding an emailed confirmation of the more expensive room, I was told the bigger rooms were first come first serve. As of this date, this is not indicated on their website or their call center. Nice room, clean, comfortable beds. Great to watch the game and great location, but no complimentary internet or continental breakfast. In fact, I was charged two 24-hour internet charges for one night. Again, they corrected their mistake. The check in staff along with the bellhops and valet were way overwhelmed, outnumbered and understaffed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: paradisevacation
Reviews.Content: I would give this hotel 3 1/2 stars if I could. It has a definite WOW factor - the fact that it is adjacent to the Rogers center and you can watch games or shows directly from the hotel restaurant or from some of the rooms. Another great feature are large windows - almost from floor to ceiling. The beds are comfortable, the liners are crispy clean. I was staying in a regular room with a King-sized bed and had a gorgeous view of CN Tower. However, this hotel definitely needs a renovation if it is to keep its star rating. Carpets look dated, bathrooms are far from modern, hallways look a bit gloomy. And the weirdest thing of all - no WiFi! It costs $13 / day to use high-speed internet with a cable or to access TV Internet. There is a business center where one can use the Internet but you are charged per minute. In terms of location, Renaissance Hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Air Canada center, the Union train station and the closest subway station. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to others, but would give them heads up not to expect any modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: chia350
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. If your going to Rogers Center its connected to it and from the bar you can watch a game or show I would guess as there are large windows overlooking it. Close to CN tower, King street etc so nice location I think. Rooms were fine and very comfortable bed and sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Action”
Reviews.Author: RosieTravelin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel because we were attending a rock concert at Rogers Centre which was connected so it was very convenient. The lobby and Arriba restaurant are very trendy. The room was traditional and very clean. However, the room could use some basic maintenance: lighting in bathroom was very dim and difficult for make-up application, tub/shower needed regrouted and there was some water damage/mold above the bed that needs repaired. But overall, I felt it was very clean and comfortable. Room 769 had a city view looking northward over tracks but the commuter train runs there and the noise did not bother us. Also, this room had a long hall between the door and the bed so we did not hear much noise from the hallway. Self-parking was $20./day with in/out privileges and $30./day for valet. To ensure adequate parking, since the same lot is used for the hotel and Rogers Centre, you may want to check for events at Rogers Centre for the day of your arrival (i.e. Toronto Blue Jays baseball game, concert, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family getaway”
Reviews.Author: Fabfive39
Reviews.Content: My husband,myself,and three teenagers,19,16,and 12, went to Toronto to attend the "Sting" concert at the Molson Amphitheatre at Ontario Place.I chose the Renaissance for the proximetry to the harborfront area of the city.The location was ideal.This hotel which is adjacant to the Rogers Center met all our needs. We booked two rooms on the fifth floor,both were spacious and quiet. The buffet breakfast which was included with our rooms was delicious and plentiful. We were able to pack alot of activivities into a short weekend stay due to the location. A city sightseeing and combined boat tour was a block way.The CN tower is literally next door,and it is a short five or six block walk to the harborfront attractions. The staff at the hotel was exemplary;front desk,foodservice,housekeeping,bellman were all extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: ltlwing64
Reviews.Content: Really great service in this hotel. I was very pleased with the room amenities and the service from all members of staff that I encountered. Layout of hallways a bit odd - either maze-like or in need of traffic calming? I guess following the contour of the Skydome (Rogers Centre) - not unpleasant, just odd! The only downside to this downtown hotel is no shuttle to Pearson airport. You need to walk over to the Intercontinental to get the shuttle - about 1.5 blocks, so not a huge deal, as long as your are able bodied! I would stay here again, especially if I was going to another event at Skydome.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: liv2vac
Reviews.Content: large room with seperate sitting area with couch and armchair and television. could use paintinng in bathroom especially cieling. We stayed here 4 nights and found it centrally located. about 3 blocks to subway and 1 and a half blocks to streetcars.The hotel backs up to rogers Center and the restaurant and more expensive rooms overlook the field. We booked using hotwire and we extremely happy with the room considering how little we paid. On our last night they had a game but we never heard a sound. There was also a refigerator under the TV. Sauna was not open as remodeling was occuring at the time in that area. If you stay here park your car and use public transportation as your charged for parking everywhere up to 3.00 for 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Jill_and_Mike
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Toronto for two nights in June 2010. Hotel was very nice and had a good location within walking distance to most of the major sites in downtown Toronto. I was travelling with work and the hotel upgraded me to a room with a view overlooking the Blue Jay's stadium. The room was awesome and had two floors which both looked out into the stadium. Too bad the Jay's weren't in town that week because that would have been a great experience. Overall, I would suggest this hotel as the staff was really nice and the easy walk to most of the Toronto attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay”
Reviews.Author: georgewCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire and couldn't have asked for a better location. Our room was very spacious and clean. The staff was very friendly. The hotel is in the Rogers Center and there is a bar with a great view of the ballpark. We happened to be in town when our hometown Giants were playing and we were able to sit in the bar and have a couple of beers while watching the game. The hotel is very close to the CN Tower, many restaurants, Chinatown, and other attractions. The parking is a bit expensive ($20/night) and you have to pay extra if you want to leave your car for a short while after checking out. Overall, I thought this was a hotel that I would definitely return to.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel, but indifferent staff.”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCat314
Reviews.Content: I normally expect great service at extravagant hotels. First off, they gave us a great room- that wasn't the problem. The problem was that our floor had maybe 100+ college students on it, roaming around, going in and out of about 5-6 rooms. It sounded like a convention on our floor. They were clearly having a party. I called the front desk and they said they would send security up, but never did. Hours later, we walked down the to the front desk and told them there was a huge party going on. The lady looked surprised and just put us in another room. I have no idea what happened to that party, but I'm a bit surprised that the staff wasn't trying to break up a huge party on their property. I had to use the internet for a few minutes, so I went downstairs and purchased a 5 min internet card for $5! Ouch. The connection was really slow, I was trying to make a reservation for another hotel for the next day, and even though my info/cc# is already registered with the site, it took forever to place the reservation, and I didn't even know if it had gone through(thankfully, it did). Their parking lot was really really far away and expensive $25/day, but that's to be expected in a big city. I normally love big glitzy hotels, but the indifferent staff was a bit of a turn off for me. Usually, hotels like these have great staff. So I was a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “1970's Brady Bunch Meets IKEA”
Reviews.Author: SCSTravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: Yes, that's the theme we finally came up with to describe the decor of this hotel. I spent more than a few moments scratching my head wondering, "Did they mean to go this route on purpose?" My husband I spent the weekend here for our wedding anniversary. Having previously honeymooned in Toronto, we decided to roll the dice for a 4 star on Hotwire - Downtown West. For $73 per night, combined with our Marriott Rewards membership, we ended up on the Club Level floor in a decent but average room looking out over the city. If you are a light sleeper, take into account the train station runs directly next to this property. This hotel is a pain in the backside to find. Thank goodness for GPS. Parking is $30 valet or $20 self-park (a hike around the block and eventually under the hotel - we passed and went with valet). Check-in was uneventful and Lucy, one of the few staff that cracked a smile, eventually found us a room with a king bed. As a side note, this hotel is part of the Rogers Center - an indoor, retractable dome stadium for the Argonauts and Toronto Blue Jays. We were there the weekend the Argonauts had a 1pm game on Sunday. Didn't create a problem for us. The bed was nothing short of heaven. The amenities were Aveda. With a tip for housekeeping, they were generously supplied. There was a Keurig (k-cup) coffee maker and mini fridge. Everything was clean and new.... just strangely out of a 1970 decorating magazine featuring IKEA like products. Breakfast brunch is offered for $15pp until noon on Saturdays and Sundays. With an omelette station and plenty to choose from, we felt the price was appropriate. The evening meal was another story. Horribly over-priced and the food over-cooked. We dined in for convenience and should have opted for elsewhere. The service was hit or miss. No one seemed to care it was our anniversary until we settled up Sunday afternoon. I wasn't expecting a surprise party but a simple response to our reason for visiting being something other than a shrug would have been thoughtful. Our Saturday morning waitress was incredibly friendly and efficient. Saturday evening's waitress seemed irritated that we were there. Sunday morning we were back to a friendly but this time harried waitress. Our room attendant was great. The front desk ranged from quietly efficient to downright cold. Again, hit or miss. If given the opportunity to stay elsewhere downtown for the same price, we'd choose differently. Hotwire is a gamble and we knew that when we booked the room, so no complaints there. If you go, definitely sign up beforehand for Marriott's free rewards program. It gets you a boost to the Club Level, by far the nicest floor of the hotel It's hard to choose Yes or No for our recommendation. $73 for a 4 star downtown is a great price. $30 for valet parking is not. Free Wifi for Rewards members is a nice perk. $1.60+ for local calls is over the top. If you're on a budget and factor in the parking, as well as planning to eat elsewhere for dinner, it might be worth the downsides to stay. If you are able to spend just a bit more, the Downtown East side seems like a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Expected Ordinary, Got Extrordinary!!!”
Reviews.Author: j0nNYC
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on hotwire.com for my girlfriends birthday weekend and ended up getting a room at the renaissance hotel rogers center. I read reviews on here about the hotel that were not so good so I was a bit nervous. We arrived and were treated great right away. We were informed that we were receiving a room with a view of the field. We were also told that there was a game the next day that we could enjoy from the comfort of our room!!! How cool is that! When we got into the room we were blown away! It was a duel level room with a raised livingroom that overlooked the rogers center field. It was soooo cool! The hotel bar is amazing aswell. It was designed back in the 90's and still has that amazing cheesy neon flare. Loved it! The bar also overlooks the field so you have an awesome view even when having a drink. The location is amazing in downtown also! It's a quick walk almost anywhere and we took full advantage of this! Torontos a great city to enjoy with one you love and this hotel was icing on the cake. We will be back fo sho!

Reviews.Title: “Toronto, Canada-Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: swarttz
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed in. The service is 5 star. The location is great. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great price from Priceline”
Reviews.Author: fchnjyh
Reviews.Content: I'll say that the hotel was very nice. We ended up with room about 1/4 mile from the elevator so we didn't hear any noise from that, but it sure was a hike getting to the room. Room was spacious with huge bathroom and aveda products, so you can't go wrong there. Staff was excellent - interacted with the front desk, housekeeping, and concierge, and all were EXTREMELY helpful. The $70 price from priceline made it really worth it - right close to the harbor area and not a far walk to union station.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel but the pool area needs attention”
Reviews.Author: jiffypop101
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here numerous times but to be frank I think that the Management of this hotel needs to wake up! How many complaints do you need to get about the pool area. Paint chips from the cealing and the floors are always filthy. It is always seemingly impossible to get a towel. They are always out. We have complained a lot as well as other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: infopro
Reviews.Content: We got a deal on PriceLine ($65), and in reading the reviews on tripadvisor were not expecting too much, but were pleasantly surprised. The room on the 8th floor was spacious, although if you are a light sleeper stay ask for a room away from the elevators - a slight rumbling could be heard in our room. The bed was very comfortable, carpets and drapes clean, but if you want to watch TV in your hotel room go elsewhere - they haven't got around to renovating those. There was a microwave on a small table in the entrance to our room - a bit odd - and a fridge where once a minibar must have been. Breakfast overlooking the Rogers Centre was interesting but the food not spectacular, no whole grain bread, but the omelette station was a nice touch - definitely stay away from the stringy bacon and overcooked scrambled eggs. $15/pp, kids under 5 free. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The pool is closed until May 2010 which probably explains the cheap rate. Would recommend at the low rate, but otherwise there are probably better places to stay if you want to sightsee.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating but still pleasant”
Reviews.Author: love2travel021
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance for two nights. We got an amazing deal through Priceline, which definitely helped us to overlook the faults of this hotel. The staff was wonderful, helpful, and friendly. The room was clean and comfortable.The location was great and close to many popular attractions. Parking was convenient and affordable. The food in the restaurant was mediocre, but honestly about what you expect from your average hotel restaurant. Unfortunately, the rooms are looking rather tired and definitely in need of an update. The window curtains were stained, as was the fabric on the office chair. The counters in the bathroom were chipped, with stained caulk around the sink as well as the tub. The floor tile was also stained. The walls are ridiculously thin, and we could hear absolutely everything said out in the hall. For a supposedly four star hotel, you just expect a little more. When we arrived our do not disturb sign was missing, as was our coffee maker. All of the accoutrements for the coffee were there, but the maker itself was gone. These are things that you expect the housekeeping service in a four star hotel to keep track of. Once we requested these items, the staff replaced the immediately. As many other reviewers have noted, there is no wifi available in the rooms. It is available free in the lobby and lounge, but how annoying. When traveling from the U.S., data roaming is expensive and forced us to sit in the lobby to use the 'net. It's 2010, and I just expect more from hotels these days. Security is also seriously lacking. Anyone off the street can stroll into the hotel and access the guest rooms. There are no security systems (such as key card in the elevator) to prevent this. We were rude awakened at 5 am by someone pounding on door asking us if we had called for a massage. When we reported this incident to the front desk in the morning, they informed us that the man had apparently been knocking on doors across the hotel until guests reported it and security kicked him out. They told my husband that they thought they stopped him at the 5th floor, and were surprised that he reached us on the 8th floor. They graciously offered us free breakfast which was kind and an example of their good customer service. We couldn't help but think however, that they really need a security update to the hotel. Another security issue we experienced involved housekeeping. We returned from a day out, stopping in only to change our clothes for a few minutes. We found a housekeeper cleaning our room. When we told her we just wanted to pop in for a few minutes, she opened the door for us and did not even check to see if we had room keys. We informed the front desk of this situation and they told us that housekeepers are trained to close the door and call the front desk to verify the guests name. This didn't happen in this situation, and it was disconcerting. Regardless of what may seem like a lot of negatives, it was a pleasant stay and I would still recommend this hotel to others. The location was great, the staff was very kind and accommodating. The management just really needs to step up security and give the rooms a little freshening.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance has some of the most comfortable beds on Earth”
Reviews.Author: eggegg
Reviews.Content: Enormous rooms, usual Renaissance/Hilton amenities (I love their shampoo!). Every room is equipped with an individual coffee machine (and the coffee is great)! You will only get 2 coffee capsules a day, so if you want more you have to buy down at the bar for $2... I imagine you could also request more caps at the reception. Beds are some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in (same true for other Renaissance hotels I have stayed at). If you get an inner room you'll have a view on the football/baseball field (most expensive I guess). I had an outwards-facing room with a view over downtown. Lobby area has free wireless Internet - ask password at the reception. Reception staff is somehow a bit passive but will be very helpful if you ask anything. I got great insider information about same day live music events in town, conversely I couldn't get much help for finding Maple Leafs tickets (generally difficult to get anyway). Sky Dome in the same building, Air Canada Centre & Union Station 10 min walk, bars & nightlife 5 (nearest) to 20 min (most of them) walking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: SherBare
Reviews.Content: We stay in Toronto a few times a year... this was the 1st time at this Renaissance. Awesome place! Staff was more than accomodating, check-in was smooth, valet parking optional. The room was very nice, clean and spacious. No watching TV in bed with the room we had.... I personally like that, my hubby did not!!! You can view the inside of the Roger's Centre (aka Sky Dome) from the Arriba Restaurant... very cool touch! Self Parking was a bit bizarre to get to but the staff help you out. It didn't help that we had to find it in a snow storm! For supper we walked down to Front St... some nice casual restaurants are just a block away. The Loose Moose is a place we frequent! Stay here... you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Time for a renovation or one less diamond”
Reviews.Author: expatrex
Reviews.Content: SUMMARY: Booking sites call this a four star property. I think thatâ€™s a stretch. The hotel interior is showing signs of its age all over, and it should really be dropped a grade unless it gets renovated. There isnâ€™t much to write home about, and whatâ€™s worse is the location is not ideal for sightseeing either. ROOMS: I was on the ninth floor with a view that overlooks the entertainment district. The TV in the room wasnâ€™t even a plasma/LCD, and the carpet was uneven with visible stains in several areas. On the other hand, the bathroom was spacious with Aveda products. SERVICE: The service was inconsistent. I had two front desk agents check me in. The first one didnâ€™t smile and then walked away mid process. Thankfully, a second agent resumed checking me in with a bit more hospitality. Later I returned to the front desk with a question, and Anna gave brilliant professional service. Thumbs up! AMENITIES: The pool was larger than expected but felt very institutional and in need of some comforting dÃ©cor in the room. The fitness center was bare bones, but apparently itâ€™s just temporary until the Rogers Center health club reopens. I was told guests can access that one in the future for free. There was comp WiFi in the lobby, which is always a perk. LOCATION: Great location if youâ€™re going to the Rogers Center, but otherwise its southwest downtown location is a bit isolated from most other touristy areas. The entertainment district is a stoneâ€™s throw away though. CLEANLINESS: In addition to stains in the room carpet, there were other instances when cleanliness was not at four star standards. Old gum on the hallway floor, stains on the backs of lobby couches, dings and marks on the walls, spilled liquid spots in the elevator, and so on.
