We took the $149 per night room rate, as it included breakfast. (Any meal at the Ariba restaurant, really, as you are credited $45 per day, from noon to noon the next day. Breakfast for two plus tip fits nicely within the $45.) I did hear a few loud talkers at 4 or 5 AM, as they returned from the nightclubs, I imagine, but nothing excessive. When you're offered a choice between the CityView room and the SkyDome view, both have their ups and downs. The CityView offers a view of the city (mostly train tracks and construction sites) but you are bothered by the trains every 10 minutes, starting at 5am. The SkyDome view is great if there's something going on in the dome, but at night, they turn everything off, and it's bleak. I was pleased with the cleanliness and the service. There's internet access and printing in the lobby area, but don't be fooled by the "Internet Access in room" promise, as it is $13 per day. There is free WiFi in the lobby, which is okay. The hotel is located in the Rogers Centre (Skydome) and is at the base of the CN tower. It's 10-15 minutes walk from the nearest bus or subway, but after that's you're all set. I would go back anytime...

Reviews.Title: “a big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: angelika0368
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for just one night. If it had been any longer I would have found a different hotel. The rooms are not at all as described, there was blood and cigarette burns in the bedding and our breakfast included in the room rate cost us $40. The pool is about 10 miles from any room and it takes weeks to find your room from the elevator as the hallways are the longest I have ever traveled. The absolute worst part however was the fact that upon check-in we were presented with a sheet of paper to sign stating that the hotel had a strict occupancy limit of four in each room and a zero tolerance policy on noise and parties. We were kept awake alllll night by what seemed like an entire floor of drunken frat boys. We started calling the front desk around eleven and called about every hour until 5am when they seemed to start passing out. Now this was not a small party, this was rooms full of drunk kids screaming, yelling and fighting both in their rooms and in the halls. Everytime we called the desk they told us that they knew about the problem because of numerous other complaints and that security was on their way. Security did not come. When I questioned the front desk in the morning as to why nothing was done about the noise I was told that "there is no way we can police the entire hotel. There were alot of parties last night and we could not take care of all of them". Never again. From now on I'll just stay at The Grand where I know I will be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Longest Corridor In the World!”
Reviews.Author: Maxdax
Reviews.Content: Room and service was very good. Location is very good if you are attending events at the Metro Center or sports arena. However... my room was located overlooking the base of the CN tower, so it was at the very end of the building. It took almost 3 minutes to walk from the (only) elevator bank to my room! Please - ask how far your room is from the elevator because the architecture of this hotel is such that the elevator bank is at one end only (and if your room is at the other, you will have a walk worse than in a Vegas mega-hotel). It was rediculous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FrannyK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights in a field view room w/ a fabulous view of two Blue Jays baseball games. We were upgraded to a bi-level suite upon check-in which was a nice surprise. The room was very clean and nicely laid-out. King bed, desk and nice bathroom on first level, up four steps was another level w/fantastic view of the ballpark, a pull-out sofa, two chairs, coffee table and TV. The people at the front desk were very helpful w/restaurant recommendations. You can use the business center there for free to print out your boarding passes. We could walk to the CN Tower and the Hockey Hall of Fame. We found a great breakfast place on Yonge called Over Easy--absolutely excellent. Went to the Keg steakhouse one night--very good. Ate ballpark food the other night. Valet parking was $24/day. Field view rooms are quite pricey during baseball season, but we felt well worth it for the experience and the look on our son's face :) Be aware check-out time for field view rooms (10:30am) is earlier than regular rooms (12pm). We loved the city of Toronto--great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mehhhh”
Reviews.Author: Silverain54
Reviews.Content: My friends and I visited this hotel for 2 nights (Aug18-19/06). When we checked in everything was fine and we got our room keys and were told how and where to park the car. Once we arrived at our room one of the keys wouldn't work but thats no big problem. The room was very clean and presented well. We were on the first floor facing the railroad tracks so there wasn't much to look at. For the price I paid we were quite happy with our room. However I do not think it is worth the $289 listed on the Marriott website. In the room we were provided with toiletries, a coffeemaker, an iron, and lots of closter and drawer space. It was pretty much just a normal hotel room. Overall we were happy with our room. What we were not happy with was the customer service. Once we realized the room key did not work we got settled in and then went down to validate our parking and fix the key. When we got to the front desk the same man who checked us in served us. He seemed pretty annoyed, I'm not sure why. On the way up to the room we went to the vending machine and I got a chocolate milk and then realized the due date was 2 weeks ago. We went back downstairs to inform the front desk and the same guy was condecending and pretty rude because I asked for my money back for the chocolate milk. He told me he would get back to me which he never did. Chocolate milk may seem insignificant but I have been to hotels where they have bent over backwards to help you over smaller things. I have stayed at the Marriott on Bloor and I found the service to be much better there. Would I stay at this hotel again? Maybe... the location is great, the parking isn't too overpriced, and the room was fine. However I felt like we weren't treated as good as we should have been and next time we will probably try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Magentis
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the SkyDome Hotel as we had purchased tickets to see a ball game and a play. The location was perfect as you're within steps of both. In addition, the CN tower is literally outside the front door. Check-in went smooth. We had booked our room using our CAA membership. This was the first hotel that actually asked to see the card. With the membership we also received a $47.00 voucher to use at their restaurant, Arriba, during our stay. It was just enough to cover breakfast! My husband went and parked the car while I went up to the room. First complaint has to do with the parking situation. The elevators are not clearly marked in the parking garage. My husband ended up climbing five sets of stairs carrying a cooler before finding a door which let him out at Gate 5 of the Rogers Center. Pay the $25 for valet parking and save yourself some misery. The rooms are spacious; however, the bathrooms are dated. The shower had the worse shower head I've every had to use and the drain in the tub was so bad that by the end of my shower I was standing in water up to my ankles. For the amount of money we paid to stay in this hotel I expected more. Read the information on the back of the door reference what to do in case of fire. During our stay the fire alarms went off at midnight. We quickly got dressed and headed out into the hallway with several other people from our floor. We all stood there trying to wake up and figure out what we were suppose to do. The Toronto Fire Dept finally came on the PA after several minutes and announced that there was a false alarm in the Rogers Center and that we could return to our rooms. The hotel's location is great and the staff is friendly; however, I still think it's a bit overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JHanshaw
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a trade show in June of 2005. The on site restaurant was delicious. It has a wonderful buffet style breakfast and it was so nice to sit in the restaurant and watch the Blue Jays practice or play a game for lunch. This hotel is within walking distance to most everything or a short taxi ride (I have to say that Tornoto had the rudest cab drivers I have ever been in contact with.) The rooms were very clean and nice. Help very friendly. The wayne Gretzsky restaurant was a lot of fun. We had a party on the rooftop. I highly recommed it to anyone who may be hosting a soiree. I have attached some photos from the rooftop. Another wonderful place to eat is Jump. Not only did it have a fabulous menu, but the environment was very contemporary and upbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Above average stay at renaissance”
Reviews.Author: OhioSchmoopie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the renaissance, the overall stay was above avarge. The room (559) had a railroad track view and at times a bit loud. Getting to the room from the elevator was far and you felt like you were in a maze! The room itself was on the small size but the bathroom was very LARGE! One thing we noticed from when we checked in there was roomservice plates in the hallway for 3 days that were never picked up! Our roomrate included buffet breakfast which was good. It was awesome view to see the baseball field during the game from restaurnat! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was good, next to cn tower and short walk to harbor front. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance for an 11 night holiday starting on 8 June. I had booked my trip through Hotwire [3.5 star downtown hotel] and had a great deal. The reception staff were most helpful at all times. Checking in and out were very easy and the friendliness of the personnel was most impressive. I had requested a non smoking king bedded room and I was allocated just that. I was very impressed with the room in terms of decor and size. Pics are attached - colour scheme especially attractive and relaxing. The only downside to the room was the lack of a fridge and a safe [although free safety deposit boxes were available in reception]. That is why I am not giving this hotel the full five star rating. Location was fine for me - 10 minutes walk to Union Station where you can catch the metro. Excellent restaurants five minutes away on King Street near the Holiday Inn. Rabba Supermarket down the road open 24 hours a day! CN Tower and Harbourfront virtually on the doorstep. The view of Rogers Stadium [the new name for the Skydome]was awesome - pic attached of both a baseball and an American Football game in progress. All in all if you get a good deal on this Hotel go for it. A limo from the airport to the Hotel was $50.00 Cdn - a treat well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: scoobie26
Reviews.Content: We booked this room over the internet from the UK as we were planning to see the Blue Jays and thought it would be easier to stay in the hotel there. Check in was quick and easy and we were able to check in 3 hours early. Our room was not field view but this was fine with us as we already had tickets for the game. Our room did however face the train tracks and it was a bit too loud for us. The room itself can not be faulted, however it would have been nice to have a fridge or a bar in the room. Overall the stay was enjoyable, but a little overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: 123me
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location a few times now and everytime I am very pleased with my choice. This past stay I was able to get a fieldview room (even though I already had tickets for the game). I spent half the game watching from the room and half from our seats which was really fun. As others have said, the hotel is not the closest to any subway station, but a 15 minute walk from Union Station won't kill you and a taxi would not cost much. Parking in Toronto, in any major city for that matter, is expensive. Deal with it. The hotel is very close to numerous restaraunts, including Wayne Gretzky's. The staff at this hotel have always been very helpful and accomodating and the rooms are clean and welcoming. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: purplemargy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance for 5 nights in total starting 6th Sept 2005. Was only meant to stay for firsst 2 nights of a 3 moth stay in Toronto, but due to problems with my rental, ending up staying a further 3 nights. Check In Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Bellboys very helpful especially in giving advice about longer-term rentals in Toronto! Room(s) Stayed with a friend for firwst 2 nights. Two large double beds, large, comfortable room with good sized bathroom. Food/Drink Didn't eat at hotel-so many good restaurants just a short walk away! Would highly recommend Cora's Breakfast/Lunch Restaurant just two blocks away. Great food, great prices and even spotted some celebs eating here during the film festival season! Price Great deals with Hotwire! When first booked, didn't know I was getting the Renaissance, but given that I had to make 3 further bookings due to a change of plans, you soon figure out which option to choose on the Hotwire website to get the Renaissance! Approx 50GBP per night for double room! All in all, a pleasant stay due to the quality of acommodation and location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a game, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: lawman
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the customer service is excellent. room was nice and large but needs some updating. One of the reasons I booked is the indoor pool, during our stay there was a bunch of teenage hockey payers who totally took over the pool and no one else could get near it. The hot tub water was so green and nasty it was unusable. The mens locker room stunk of urine. I would try a different hotel next time, pool area needs alot of work and there is no reason for it not being clean.

Reviews.Title: “Detailed review of Fieldview room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I looked into booking a room at the Renaissance Toronto Hotel Downtown (previously "Skydome Hotel"), I wanted to read a detailed review, but couldn't find any, so I'm going to write one up now, hopefully it'll help you if you're deciding whether to shell out the bucks for a room : ) My husband and I just returned from a 1-night stay for the Friday, April 21, 2006 game (Jays vs. Red Sox). Arriving and Parking If you are driving in from Gardiner Express, get off on Spadina and go North. Turn right on Front Street, then another right on Blue Jays Way. Once you are on Blue Jays Way, you should see a sign for the Renaissance hotel on your left hand side. If you would like Valet Parking ($25), turn into the hotel entrance and there should be valet attendants waiting to take your car. However, if you want to save a few bucks and do self-parking ($18), keep driving on Blue Jays Way pass the hotel entrance, turn left at the next street, then another left (essentially, you are circling the dome) until you see a big Rogers sign on the side of the stadium (near the ticketing office). At this point, on your right side, you should see a ramp going down with signs that say "Rogers Centre parking". This is the same parking garage as the hotel. Note that there is no sign that actually says "Renaissance hotel parking" or "Hotel parking", so it took us a while to find it. Just drive up to the security booth in front of the parking garage (they will ask to see your trunk) and go down the ramp. The garage itself is colour-coded for different parts of the stadium, so follow the signs for "hotel" until you get to the Purple section, then park anywhere close to the elevator that will go directly up to the hotel lobby. Check-in The check-in time was listed as 3:00pm, but when we arrived at 4:30pm, the room was still not ready. We had booked an Executive Fieldview Suite (more on rooms later), but when I checked in, the front desk receptionist tried to give me a regular Fieldview room. I explained that it was a different type of room, so she grudging said something about the room not being ready yet, and told me to wait 5 mins while she calls up house-keeping to check. I waited around for about 15 mins before my room was finally assigned properly (Room #434). While checking in, they also make you sign some type of "waiver" saying that 1) you will not throw objects out the window, 2) you will only have a maximum of 5 people viewing the game in your room (for regular Fieldview rooms), 6 for Executive Fieldview Suites, and 10 for Bi-Level Suites, and 3) you will check out at 10:00am if there is an afternoon game the next day (which there was), or 12:00pm otherwise. Since the website had listed the check-out time at 12:00 and we were told to leave at 10:00am (plus we had to wait around for the room to be ready during check-in), I managed to wrangle 2 free breakfast buffet vouchers out of the receptionist : ) Room The hotel has 348 rooms, but only 70 of these overlook the baseball fields. These 70 rooms are mostly on the 4th floor of the hotel, which is at the same height as the 500 level of the dome. They are on the outfield side of the field. There are 3 types of rooms: Fieldview room: These are similar to regular hotel rooms, with either one King size bed, or two double beds (sleeps maximum 4). Executive Fieldview suite (regular room + $100): These are almost the same size as the fieldview rooms, but it has some mini-stairs to take you up to a raised platform (see pictures) where you can see the game. The only advantage I can see for this is you get a bit more privacy (if you have the curtains open, the bed area is hidden). Otherwise, it's not much different from a regular room. Bi-Level suite: (regular room + $300): These suites have two levels. The first is a living room with a couch and some chairs. Upstairs is the bedroom and bathroom. We had an Executive Fieldview suite, #434. The room itself was nice and clean, with good air conditioning. The bathroom was very nice, with marble floors and countertops. There is a bathtub with shower, but no jet sprays in the tub. The bed we got was a comfortable King-size, with 3 pillows of different softness that you can choose from. Go up several steps of stairs, and there are two armchairs that face the field, plus a work desk with a phone and internet connection. Note that internet connection is not free (costs about $10 extra for 24 hours). Local calls are $1.50 per call. We also noticed that there is a coffee maker, but no fridge in the room, so if you are planning to bring some soda or beer to watch the game, freeze it before you go. The floor-to-ceiling windows had a good view of the field, and you can open the top half of the window and stick your head out. Directly below our room were several seats in the Sightlines Restaurant, and we can also see the 200 level seats and into the Blue Jays bullpen. Since the rooms are on the same side as the JumboTron, you won't be able to see what's on there during the game. However, facing out towards the field, there is a screen on the left side that shows the batter, the another screen on the right side that shows the score/outs. In addition, you can turn on the TV in the room (channel 22 is Sportsnet, 30 is TSN), and you can hear the play-by-play commentary and replays if you miss anything. Note that the broadcast has a 5 second delay so it won't exactly match up (good for catching replays, though). Food There are several restaurants located in the Rogers Centre. Windows Restaurant is inside with floor to ceiling windows where you can see the field. Sightlines Restaurant is slightly smaller, but is "open-air", meaning there is no window between the tables and the field. There is also a Hard Rock cafe with windows that overlook the field. In the lobby, there are also some seats where you can order a drink (and perhaps snacks), called the Arriba Restaurant. This lobby restaurant is also where the breakfast buffet is located for the complimentary breakfast in the morning. Since we wanted to watch batting practice from our room, we looked into ordering room service. As expected, the prices were pretty high ($12.95 for a roast beef sandwich), so instead of room service, we called Pizza Pizza and ordered delivery (a medium meat supreme pizza is only $15.80 including tax). They delivered directly to the hotel and front desk calls up to your room when they arrive. You just have to go down to the lobby to meet them and take it up to your room. We also had our complimentary breakfast buffet (normally the breakfast buffet costs $17.95) the next day after checking out at 10am. The "Arriba restaurant" is really the lobby bar and they set up a buffet table on the side. When we got there, there was a HUGE line and we ended up waiting about 30 mins for a table. Even when we left at 11am, there were still people waiting for seats, so if you're in a hurry, you may want to grab breakfast somewhere else. The saving grace is that the restaurant overlooks the field and you can watch batting practice while you're waiting. There is made-to-order omlettes, scrambled eggs, sausage links, bacon, waffles, potato wedges, fruits, yogurt, muffins, and bagels. The orange juice and coffee is also included. We thought the breakfast was pretty good, but wouldn't pay $17.95 for it if it wasn't included. Summary We had an awesome time! Being able to watch batting practice and the whole game from our room was a really cool experience. In fact, this hotel is the only hotel in the world that's built into a stadium. Other than a brief mix-up during check-in, our stay was great and very memorable. We definitely recommend shelling out the extra bucks for a room, especially if you're a baseball fan. It'll be an experience you'll never forget. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Uninteresting”
Reviews.Author: ednacloud
Reviews.Content: The welcome was good. The room distinctly average. Shower not very powerful but huge bathroom. The bar and restaurant that overlook the Rogers Stadium are distinctly average, food not the best. The restaurant had just reopened after a renovation so they may have had some settling in to do. A lounge to relax in would be good. The bar isn't a place to relax with high stools as seating. We didn't eat in the Hard Rock Cafe next to the hotel. Room overlooked railtracks, very noisy. Not much soundproofing. There's not an awful lot of dining options nearby, and it's a good 15 minutes walk to the downtown core.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a weekend. Got upgraded to a suite on arrival because of my Marriott status. Service was average--they forgot the jams that came with the room service breakfast. Also had to ask twice for a showercap/razor to be brought up to the room. Otherwise housekeeping was great. From the airport, I actually took the bus and then the subway to get to the hotel--it takes forever!!! I took the indoor pedway from Union Station to the hotel. It took more than 1 hour from airport to hotel, mostly due to a long wait time for the bus which goes to all the terminals before driving to the subway station. It is probably better to take a taxi. Unfortunately highway and downtown traffic is also a pain. My husband had a rental car--getting to the underground parking lot of the hotel is somewhat confusing. The concierge was great. There are a lot of restaurants and bars on King St. to check out nearby. This hotel is right next to the convention center and CN Tower. And of course Blue Jays games if you're lucky enough to have a room when they're playing!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in level of service”
Reviews.Author: ckrobyn
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at this property for business and was a little suprised by the lack of attentiveness, especially on the Club Level of the hotel. I am a loyal Marriott customer and try to find a Marriott in whatever city I happen to be visiting. I stayed at this hotel (in my home city) while attending a convention in downtown Toronto. I booked a club level room and was assured the additional services and amenities more than made up for the price difference between this and a standard room. First of all, I had requested an early check in and when I arrived at 1:00pm they did not have a room ready for me - this was okay, I understand that they can accept a request only if they can accommodate it on the day of arrival. I left my bags with the concierge and went off to my meeting, when I arrived back at the hotel at 4:00pm, I was told my room was still not ready! Regular check in without a request for early check in is supposed to be at 3:00pm! By this time I was a bit tired and just wanted to relax. Finally, at almost 5:00pm I was told that my room was finally ready. I went up to the club floor (6) and found my room. Maybe my expectations were too high, but this room was nothing to write home about. It was quite small and very sparsley furnished. I looked for the mini bar but there wasn't one - not even a small fridge to store soda in. I called down and asked for a fridge and they sent one up which looked beat up and about 10 years old. Aside from the above, the hotel lobby was lovely and there are plenty of areas to see the Rogers Centre and baseball field. I enjoyed the complimentary snacks and drinks in the 6th floor concierge lounge, BUT, and that's a big but - I piled my dishes and glasses outside my door starting the day I checked in, and the same dishes and glasses ( with a few added over 2 days) were still there the day I checked out! I cannot believe the number of employees that passed by this hallway and did not remove the dirty dishes! Not only that, I had turn down service so I know someone had to have seen these dishes and basically ignored them. Had I known where to turn these in I would have done it myself. I am disappointed in the lack of attention and service at this property. I am used to Marriotts high level of service and this hotel just doesn't cut it. At almost $300 a night - I expected ( and I think deserved) much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference from Mar 1st to March 5th. The room was very spacious, bathroom very spacious too - and very very clean. The beds were really really comfortable! The staff (all of them - inclduing the doorman, the front desk staff and wait staff) were kind, and extremely courteous. I had requested no maid service for a day and then realized I needed more shampoo, conditioner etc, and they brought it up to my room in seconds. The fitness area is pretty good, although desperately needs air conditioning - it wasn't just a little warm, it was stifling, and all they had was one tiny fan on the floor. The pool is great too, although for hotel guests you have to walk acorss the (very wet and slippery)pool deck, which is funny becasue most regular gyms encourage you to change into dry footwear after coming in from outside. Great hotel, great service - I would definitely recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Basically what you would expect from a Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in a great location. As other posters have mentioned it is in a good location (close to SkyDome and Rogers Centre). It was a bit of a hike to the Eaton Center but not that big of a deal. The rooms were all very clean and the pool and gym were quite impressive (although the Hottub was a little foggy and could probably use a cleaning).

Reviews.Title: “Rather satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a convenient location, close to the Rogers Centre (formerly SkyDome) and close to other major attractions. It was somewhat far to walk to shopping, but the nearest subway stop isn't far, so it was convenient. Rooms were well appointed and seemed rather new, service was attentive and the room was spotless. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but remote location”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidfromMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights on last 2 days of Sept. First impressions count and I did not get a warm, fuzzy feeling at the small reception desk, manned by a single person. Not the hallmark of a great establishment. As I walked towards my room, I got that sinking feeling when I realized my room was directly behind the elevators. Not to worry, the room was nice enough. Excellent bedding. Neat bathroom tucked away in the corner, although zero counter space at the sink. In the bedroom, the work area was awful because the desk is too small, the lighting too dim and working while facing the dark wall was quite dreary. Surprisingly, the room was very quiet and I slept soundly. Next best thing is the breakfast lounge on the 6th (?) floor. Don't know if I was given access because I booked as a corporate traveler, although this was my 1st visit to the hotel. The breakfast table is very well laid-out, complete with baked goods, fruits, cereals, yoghurts, hot beverages and juices. Excellent coffee, BTW. Then you choose your own table, plunk down in the comfortable chairs and relax. The hotel itself is nice, but I did not care for the location. Even the front of the hotel is awkward, like stepping right into a parking lot, with no sidewalk to walk safely to the street. Overall, this hotel is not bad but coming back to Toronto again for 2 nights, I was determined to find better comfort at place more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and it was a nice bargain. The front desk clerk was friendly and welcoming and answered any questions we had. We opted for self parking ($18 CAN per night)and I was very happy with that. The parking area was easy to find and get to, it was covered, and was safe. There is access from the the self park area right to the hotel so you don't have to go outside or anything. Our room was nice. The bathroom was very large, clean, and brightly lit. We were put on the first floor, which was kind of annoying, since if we opened the curtains, everyone entering and leaving the hotel would be able to see everything. Oh well, we booked through Priceline and got a good deal. The pool area was average. You have to go down the first elevator and down a seperate elevator to get to the pool (just including this info. in case you need it). We called down to the pool to ask where it was located and the person who answered at that desk told us they couldn't answer that question for us and we would have to call the front desk. Didn't really understand that, but whatever. Oh, and the whirlpool bath was lukewarm at best. There are 2 saunas as well. I thought this hotel was a bit far from the subway, that is my one big complaint. It took us about 15 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Union Station stop. But, you walk through the Entertainment District so the walk is not too bad. All in all, it was a nice stay, the service was friendly and unobtrusive, and I would be happy to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the room hated the service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto on business quite often but I had never stayed at the Renaissance. I thought since I was travelling to toronto with my family rather than for work, we would stay at this hotel. My kids liked the idea that it was close to the CN Tower. I would never stay at this hotel again. I thought the front desk employees were friendly and unwelcoming. I asked who the manager on duty would be so I could voice my opinion on the bad service we received and the manager on duty clearly heard me because she looked over at me and then walked away. I guess she didn't want to deal with customers that day. I found the reception to be unwelcoming. my business was clearly unappreciated. I could have stayed somewhere else for half the price and 100% better service.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've read some bad reveiws on your website but I guess my son & I were fortunate. We came up for the Argo's [football] & the Blue Jay's / Indians [baseball] game. We received excellent service from the entire staff. The Lounge, Valet, & Room Service was trouble free. The front desk even put forth a lot of extra effort to help find the best room for our situation. The room we had a feild veiw which was very nice. Our 3 days there went by quickly & we would've stayed longer but we were on a shedule & Niagra Falls was the next stop which your staff helped find us a room there too. We had a small mix up with the bill when checking out but even this was quickly corrected. Our stay here was perfect & we hope to be back soon for the Raptor's / Cavalier's besketball game. We will be staying here. Thanks for a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Thieving at this horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: stayed one night at this horrible hotel. i decided to bring cash for my trip to shop with instead of putting everything on my credit cards.. Well to make a short story of it, i brought several hundred dollars with me. When i went out on saturday night, i left the bulk of my cash in the room instead of carry it on me,, the room by the way has no safe in it. Who knew that when i returned later that night $500 would be taken from my room.. I was told there was a bed turn down service on the club floor where i was on,,,, and that their staff came it to turn down my bed,,, but did that have to include my cash being taken,,, all of it. the hotel management even tried to suggest that maybe when i left the room , my door didnt close all the way and someone maybe walking by enterred,,, yeah right. all i know i am out lots of money, no phone call from the general manager after 3 days, and no offer of any sort of compensation. i would not recomend this hotel, because if the staff did indeed take my cash, what would they do to your stuff??

Reviews.Title: “Average At Best”
Reviews.Author: cold_in_kitchener
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 1 night stay at the Renaissance and were not overly impressed. The hotel is expensive and for what you pay more should be expected. On the positive side, the location is great. We were able to walk everywhere and the area surrounding the hotel is safe and comfortable. On the negative side, the service was very poor. Also, the room was not overly clean, as pieces of garbage were on the floor and we found hair on the pillows and in the bathroom. Check-in was a hassle and very time consuming. Staff were less than helpful and seemed to not know what they were doing. Parking is expensive, and food is expensive. Do not waste your money and eat in the hotel restaurants. Better food and views of the SkyDome are available from others just a short walk away. Overall, for the money it costs to stay here, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Real on The Ren!!!”
Reviews.Author: thbigeasyshow
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel . It was a great stay but as previosly mentioned it has no soul!!!! The people at the front desk were very nice and the concierge (i know i spelled that wrong ...but oh well) was exceptional by giving us a free breakfast and a 50% refund when she recomended a tour for us in which the double decker bus broke down on the way back!!!! The valet is another story!!! When my wife went to valet and asked that the car be brought up so that she can retrieve some valuables from it she was told that she could have done that herself!!!!!!! Also, the pool area is kinda nasty!!!! The ceiling has falling paint chips and the floor is moldy "yikes!!" . While we were in the pool one day the pool guy dipped his dirty bucket in the pool that he used to scrubb the shower area!!!!(pretty nasty)..........Other then that we had a cool stay here. We were upgraded to a Jr. Suite with a stadium veiw for free (no game but it was still a cool view). To me this hotel is more like a three star than a four!!! Im glad I didnt pay full price!!! a whopping $500 a night!!! oouch!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Toronto Downtown Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1 Blue Jays Way, Toronto, Ontario M5V 1J4, Canada
